- repeat the acceptance test for the safe brake test if the brake test is used.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: HLA, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: SI Motion P1 (CU): Hardware fault safety-relevant encoder
SINAMICSAlarm.ShortName: SI Mtn P1: HW fault enc
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Hardware/software error

Cause.CauseText: The encoder that is used for the safety-relevant motion monitoring functions signals a hardware fault.
Message value (r9749, interpret decimal):
Encoder status word 1, encoder status word 2 that resulted in the message.

Remedy.RemedyText: - check the encoder connection.
- replace encoder.
This message can be acknowledged without a POWER ON as follows (safe acknowledgment):
- Terminal Module 54F (TM54F).
- onboard F-DI (only CU310-2).
- PROFIsafe.
- machine control panel.
Note regarding encoder replacement for a third-party motor:
The serial number of the encoder must be copied in order to acknowledge this safety message.
This can be realized using p0440 = 1 or p1990 = 1.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: HLA, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: SI Motion P1 (CU): Effectivity test fault safety-relevant encoder
SINAMICSAlarm.ShortName: SI Mtn P1: eff test F enc
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Safety monitoring channel has identified an error

Cause.CauseText: The DRIVE-CLiQ encoder for safe motion monitoring signals an error for the effectivity tests.
Message value (r9749, interpret decimal):
Only for internal Siemens troubleshooting.

Remedy.RemedyText: - check the encoder connection.
- replace encoder.
This message can be acknowledged without a POWER ON as follows (safe acknowledgment):
- Terminal Module 54F (TM54F).
- onboard F-DI (only CU310-2).
- PROFIsafe.
- machine control panel.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: HLA, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: SI Motion P1 (CU): reference position invalid
SINAMICSAlarm.ShortName: SI Mtn P1: ref pos inval
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Safety monitoring channel has identified an error

Cause.CauseText: The transferred reference position is invalid.
Message value (r9749, interpret decimal):
1: It is not possible to directly transfer the reference position (p9573=89).
2: It is not possible to transfer the reference position into the motion.

Remedy.RemedyText: - unpark axis/encoder.
- acknowledge encoder fault
- deactivate gearbox stage switchover.
- when referencing via the Safety Control Channel (SCC), enable the function "Referencing via SCC" (p9501.27/9301.27).
This message can be acknowledged as follows:
- motion monitoring functions integrated in the drive: Via Terminal Module 54F (TM54F) or PROFIsafe

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: SI Motion P1 (CU): Discrepancy error of the failsafe inputs/outputs
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Safety monitoring channel has identified an error

Cause.CauseText: The failsafe digital inputs/digital outputs (F-DI/F-DO) show a different state longer than that parameterized in p10002/p10102 - or too many switching operations took place within a monitoring cycle p10002.
Fault value (r0949, interpret bitwise binary):
yyyyxxxx bin
xxxx: Discrepancy error for failsafe digital inputs (F-DI).
Bit 0: Discrepancy error for F-DI 0
Bit 1: Discrepancy error for F-DI 1
yyyy: Discrepancy error for failsafe digital outputs (F-DO).
Bit 0: Discrepancy error for F-DO 0
Note:
If several discrepancy errors occur consecutively, then this message is only signaled for the first error that occurs.

Remedy.RemedyText: - check the wiring of the F-DI (contact problems).

- if the wiring is correct, and for example there is no wire breakage, then a check must be made as to whether the switching frequency at F-DI is too high and must therefore be reduced (switching pulses must have have a longer time between them). The time interval between each signal edge at an F-DI must be at least equal to the discrepancy time before the input is switched again.
Note:
This message can be acknowledged via F-DI or PROFIsafe (safe acknowledgment).

Discrepancy errors of an F-DI can only be acknowledged if safe acknowledgment was carried out once after the cause of the error was resolved (p10006, acknowledgment via PROFIsafe, extended message acknowledgment). As long as safety acknowledgment was not carried out, the corresponding F-DI stays in the safe state internally.
When the "Extended message acknowledgment" function (p9507.0) is active, the following applies:
If the F-DI assigned for STO or SS1 is in a failsafe state due to a discrepancy error, then when deselecting via this F-DI, safe acknowledgment can no longer be executed.
Sets the discrepancy time for fast switching operations at the F-DIs:
For fast switching operations at the failsafe digital inputs (F-DI), it may be necessary to adapt the discrepancy time to the switching frequency:
- the period of a cyclic switching pulse must be less than half of the discrepancy time (if necessary, round down).
- the time between two fast switching pulses should be longer than the discrepancy time (if necessary, round up).
- the discrepancy time must be at least p9500 (it must always be rounded-down or rounded-up to an integer multiple of the SI sampling time p9500).
If a debounce time has been parameterized (p10017 > 0), then the shortest possible discrepancy time is directly specified using the debounce time.
- the period of a cyclic switching pulse must be less than half of the discrepancy time p10017 (if necessary, round down).
- the time between two fast switching pulses should be longer than the discrepancy time+p10017 (if necessary, round up).
- the discrepancy time must be at least p9500 The debounce time must always be set less than the discrepancy time.
Example:
If the SI sampling cycle is 12 ms and the switching frequency is 110 ms (p10017 = 0), the maximum discrepancy time which can be set is as follows:
p10002 <= 110/2 ms - 12 ms = 43 ms --> rounded-off, the following is obtained p10002 <= 36 ms

Since the discrepancy time can only be accepted as a whole SI sampling time, the value will need to be rounded up or down to a whole SI sampling time value if it is not an exact integer multiple of an SI sampling time.
Basic secondary condition to set the discrepancy time:
The discrepancy time of the F-DIs must always be longer than the longest SI sampling time of all drives that use Safety Integrated with TM54F (p9780/p9500).
Note:
F-DI: Failsafe Digital Input
F-DO: Failsafe Digital Output

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: SI Motion P1 (CU): Test stop for failsafe digital outputs running
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Safety monitoring channel has identified an error

Cause.CauseText: The forced checking procedure (test stop) for the failsafe digital inputs is currently in progress.

Remedy.RemedyText: The alarm is automatically withdraw after successfully ending or canceling (when a fault condition occurs) the test stop.
Note:
F-DO: Failsafe Digital Output

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: SI Motion P1 (CU): Test stop failsafe digital output error
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Safety monitoring channel has identified an error

Cause.CauseText: A fault has occurred on processor 1 during the forced checking procedure (test stop) of the failsafe digital output.
Fault value (r0949, interpret hexadecimal):
RRRVWXYZ hex:
R: Reserved.
V: Actual state of the DO channel concerned (see X) on processor 1 (corresponds to the states read back from the hardware, bit 0 = DO 0, bit 1 = DO 1, etc.).
W: Required state of the DO channel concerned (see X, bit 0 = DO 0, bit 1 = DO 1, etc.).
X: DO channels involved, which indicate an error (bit 0 = DO 0, bit 1 = DO 1, etc.).
Y: Reason for the test stop fault.
Z: State of the test stop in which the fault has occurred.
Y: Reason for the test stop fault
Y = 1: Processor 2 in incorrect test stop state (internal fault).
Y = 2: Expected states of the DOs were not fulfilled (CU305: readback via DI 22 / CU240 readback DI 5).
Y = 3: Incorrect timer state on processor 1 (internal fault)
Y = 4: Expected states of the diag DOs were not fulfilled (CU305: internal readback on processor 2).
Y = 5: Expected states of the second diag DOs were not fulfilled (CU305: internal readback on processor 1).
X and V indicate the DI or Diag-DO state dependent upon the reason for the fault (2, 4 or 5).
In the event of multiple test stop faults, the first one that occurred is shown.
Z: Test stop state and associated test actions
Z = 0 ... 3: Synchronization phase of test stop between processor 1 and processor 2 no switching operations
Z = 4: DO + OFF and DO - OFF
Z = 5: Check to see if states are as expected
Z = 6: DO + ON and DO - ON
Z = 7: Check to see if states are as expected
Z = 8: DO + OFF and DO - ON
Z = 9: Check to see if states are as expected
Z = 10: DO + ON and DO - OFF
Z = 11: Check to see if states are as expected
Z = 12: DO + OFF and DO - OFF
Z = 13: Check to see if states are as expected
Z = 14: End of test stop
Diag expected states in table format:
Test stop state: Expectation Mode 1 / Mode 2 / Mode 3 / Mode 4
Second diag expected states in table format:
Test stop state: Expectation Mode 1 / Mode 2 / Mode 3 / Mode 4
DI expected states in table format:
Test stop state: Expectation Mode 1 / Mode 2 / Mode 3 / Mode 4
Example:
Fault F01773 (P1) is signaled with fault value = 0001_0127 and fault F30773 (P2) is signaled with fault value 0000_0127.
This means that in state 7 (Z = 7) the state of the external readback signal was not set correctly (Y = 2) after DO-0 (X = 1) was switched to ON/ON.
Fault value 0001_0127 indicates that 0 was expected (W = 0) and 1 (V = 1) was read back from the hardware.
Fault value 0000_0127 on the processor 2 indicates that the states were as expected.
In the case of fault F30773, W and V are always identical; a value of 0 always means that 0 was expected at the readback input but was not present on processor 1.

Remedy.RemedyText: Check the wiring of the failsafe digital output (F-DO) and restart the test stop.
Note:
- the fault is withdrawn if the test stop is successfully completed.
- in the event of multiple test stop faults, the first one that occurred is shown. Once the test stop has been restarted the next queued test stop fault will be signaled (if there is one).
F-DO: Failsafe Digital Output

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: SI Motion P1 (CU): Test stop for failsafe digital outputs required
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Safety monitoring channel has identified an error

Cause.CauseText: The time set in p10003 for the forced checking procedure (test stop) for the failsafe digital outputs has been exceeded. A new forced checking procedure is required.
After the next time the forced checking procedure is selected, the message is withdrawn and the monitoring time is reset.
Note:
- this message does not result in a safety stop response.

- the test must be performed within a defined, maximum time interval (p10003, maximum of 8760 hours) in order to comply with the requirements as laid down in the standards for timely fault detection and the conditions to calculate the failure rates of safety functions (PFH value). Operation beyond this maximum time period is permissible if it can be ensured that the forced checking procedure is performed before persons enter the hazardous area and who are depending on the safety functions correctly functioning.

Remedy.RemedyText: Carry out the forced checking procedure for the digital outputs.
The signal source to select the forced checking procedure is set via binector input p10007.
Note:
F-DO: Failsafe Digital Output

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: SBT When selected, the brake is closed
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Safety monitoring channel has identified an error

Cause.CauseText: When selecting the brake test or starting the brake test, not all of the brakes were open.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret binary):
Bit 0 = 1:
The internal brake is closed.
Bit 1 = 1:
The external brake is closed (p10230.5, p10235.5, p10202).
Note:
The alarm is also issued, if a brake has not been configured in p10202.
SBT: Safe Brake Test

CauseParameterList.Text: p10202 (SI Motion SBT brake selection), p10230 (SI Motion SBT control word), p10235 (SI Safety Control Channel control word S_STW3B)

Remedy.RemedyText: Open all brakes and reselect the brake test (p10230.0, p10235.0).

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: SBT brake opening time exceeded
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Safety monitoring channel has identified an error

Cause.CauseText: The maximum time (11 s) to open the brake during the brake test was exceeded.
Possible causes:
- during the brake test the drive went into a fault condition, and therefore the brake was closed by the drive.
- for an external brake, the feedback signal "Brake closed" was signaled too long (p10230.5, p10235).
Alarm value (r2124, interpret binary):
Bit 0 = 1:
Internal brake was not able to be opened.
Bit 1 = 1:
External brake was not able to be opened.
Note:
SBT: Safe Brake Test

Remedy.RemedyText: - carry out a safe acknowledgment.
- restart the brake test (p10230.1, p10235.1).

RemedyParameterList.Text: p10230 (SI Motion SBT control word), p10235 (SI Safety Control Channel control word S_STW3B)

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: SBT brake test incorrect control
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Safety monitoring channel has identified an error

Cause.CauseText: The brake test was canceled as a result of incorrect control.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret binary):
Alarm value 0:
The brake test was canceled as a result of a fault (brake opening time or brake closing time exceeded).
Bit 0:
The safe brake test was canceled by resetting the brake test selection.
Bit 1:
The safe brake test was canceled by resetting the brake test start.
Bit 2:
The brake, which was selected at the start of the brake test, has not been configured in p10202.
When starting the brake test, as a result of the test top selection, brake 1 is not configured as internal brake.
There is a brake test configuration error. In this case, alarm A01785 is also output.
Note:
SBT: Safe Brake Test

Remedy.RemedyText: - check parameterization of the brake test (p10202).
- check as to whether alarm A01785 is present, and if so, evaluate.
- carry out a safe acknowledgment.
- if required, restart the brake test.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: SBT brake closing time exceeded
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Safety monitoring channel has identified an error

Cause.CauseText: The maximum time (11 s) to close the brake during the brake test was exceeded.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret binary):
Bit 0 = 1:
Internal brake was not able to be closed.
Bit 1 = 1:
External brake was not able to be closed.
Note:
SBT: Safe Brake Test

Remedy.RemedyText: - When using an external brake, check that the feedback signal "brake closed" is correctly interconnected with the control word of the brake test (p10230.5, p10235.5).
- When using an internal brake with external feedback signal, check whether the feedback signal is correctly interconnected with the extended brake control.
- carry out a safe acknowledgment.
- restart the brake test (p10230.1, p10235.1).

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: SBT brake test canceled with fault
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Safety monitoring channel has identified an error

Cause.CauseText: The safe brake test was canceled as a result of a fault.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret binary):
Bit 17 = 1: fault in the brake test sequence (cause, see bits 0 ... 10).
Bit 18 = 1: the internal brake is closed. It must be open when the external brake is tested (p10202).
Bit 19 = 1: the external brake is closed. It must be open when the internal brake is tested (p10202).
Bit 20 = 1: not all brakes are open (p10202).
Bit 21 = 1: axis position during the brake test not valid due to parking axis.
Bit 22 = 1: internal software error.
Bit 23 = 1: the permissible position range of the axis was violated with the brake closed (p10212/p10222).
Bit 24 = 1: the tested internal brake was opened while the brake test was active.
Bit 25 = 1: the tested external brake was opened while the brake test was active.
Bit 26 = 1: during the active brake test, the test torque left its tolerance bandwidth (20 %).
Cause for alarm value bit 17:
Bit 0 = 1: operation when selecting the brake test not enabled (r0899.2 = 0).
Bit 1 = 1: external fault occurred (e.g. the brake test that has already started is canceled by the user).
Bit 2 = 1: when selecting the brake test a brake is closed.
Bit 3 = 1: when determining the load torque a brake is closed.
Bit 4 = 1: A fault has occurred with stop response (e.g. OFF1, OFF2 or OFF3) - or the pulse enable was withdrawn (e.g. STO selected or operation no longer enabled).
Bit 5 = 1: when selecting the brake test the axis speed setpoint is too high.
Bit 6 = 1: the actual speed (r0063) of the axis is too high (e.g. brake does not hold during the brake test).
Bit 7 = 1: Incorrect speed controller mode (e.g. encoderless speed control or U/f operation).
Bit 8 = 1: closed-loop control not enabled or function generator active.
Bit 9 = 1: control does not switch over to the brake test (e.g. because PI speed control has not been parameterized).
Bit 10 = 1: torque limit reached (r1407.7, r1408.8).
Note:
SBT: Safe Brake Test

Remedy.RemedyText: - remove the fault cause.
- carry out a safe acknowledgment.
- if required, restart the brake test.
For bit 17 = 1 with bit 6 = 1 or bit 23 = 1:
If the brake closing time of the motor holding brake (p1217) has been set too low, then at the start of the brake test, the brake is closed too late. The brake closing time should be adapted (p1217).

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: SBT brake test configuration error
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Safety monitoring channel has identified an error

Cause.CauseText: Error when parameterizing the brake test.
In this configuration, the brake test cannot be started or cannot be started without error.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret decimal):
No motion monitoring functions have been enabled.
Two internal brakes were configured (p10202).
No internal brakes were configured (p10202).
The brake test is configured for an internal brake, however the safety brake control is not enabled (p9602/p9802).
Note:
From firmware version 5.1, SBT without SBC is also permitted for the internal brake.
The safe brake test and Safety without encoder are simultaneously enabled (p9306/p9506). This is not permissible.
The Safe Brake Test and vector U/f control is enabled. The safe brake test is not possible in this control mode.
Note:
SBC: Safe Brake Control
SBT: Safe Brake Test

Remedy.RemedyText: Check parameterization of the brake test.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: HLA, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: SCC signal source changed
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Safety monitoring channel has identified an error

Cause.CauseText: The signal source in p10235 or p10250 was changed.
The new signal source is effective immediately.
Note:
SCC: Safety Control Channel

CauseParameterList.Text: p10235 (SI Safety Control Channel control word S_STW3B), p10250 (SI Safety Control Channel control word S_STW1B)

Remedy.RemedyText: Acknowledge fault.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: SBT motor type different
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Safety monitoring channel has identified an error

Cause.CauseText: The motor type set for the safe brake test (p10204) does not match the motor type set via the function module (r0108.12).

Remedy.RemedyText: Adapt the motor type set for the safe brake test.
Note:
All of the parameters for the brake test, whose unit depends on the motor type, should be checked.

RemedyParameterList.Text: p10204 (SI Motion SBT motor type), p10209

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: HLA, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: SI: Automatic test stop waits for STO deselection via motion monitoring functions
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Safety monitoring channel has identified an error

Cause.CauseText: The automatic test stop (forced checking procedure) was not able to be carried out after powering up.
Possible causes:
- the STO function is selected via safe motion monitoring functions.
- a safety message is present, that resulted in a STO.
Note:
STO: Safe Torque Off

Remedy.RemedyText: - deselect STO via safe motion monitoring functions.
- remove the cause of the safety messages and acknowledge the messages.
Note:
The automatic test stop is performed after removing the cause.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: SI: Automatic test stop and brake test when test stop is selected not permitted
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Safety monitoring channel has identified an error

Cause.CauseText: The parameterization of the automatic test stop (p9507.6/p9307.6) and the brake test when a test stop is selected (p10203 = 2) are not permissible.
The test stop is not automatically carried out when the powering up.

Remedy.RemedyText: - correct the parameter assignment.
- set p10203 not equal to 2 or deactivate the automatic test stop.
Note:
A warm restart or POWER ON is required to carry out the automatic test stop.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: SI Motion: check modulo value for safe position via PROFIsafe
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Hardware/software error

Cause.CauseText: When parameterizing the modulo value for safe position via PROFIsafe (p9505) the position actual value can jump when the range that can be represented overflows.
Range that can be represented:
- 32-bit value: +/- 2048 revolutions
- 16-bit value: +/- 2048 revolutions (depending on p9574)

Remedy.RemedyText: Correct the parameter assignment.
Set p9505 to 2^n revolutions - and to complete revolutions (i.e. a multiple of 360 ).
Note:

This alarm can be hidden for the case that the possible position actual value jump can be tolerated for the particular application, or does not represent a problem; for example because the parameterized modulo range fits "almost as integer number" in the range of +/- 2048 revolutions that can be represented.
To re-parameterize the alarm to "NO REPORT", it is not permissible that the alarm is present. As a consequence, the following sequence is required for the re-parameterization:
- correct p9505 to "2^n".
- re-parameterize the alarm using p2118 and p2119.
- set p9505 back to the required value.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: SI Motion P1 (CU): Wait time after exiting the safe pulse cancellation expired
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Safety monitoring channel has identified an error

Cause.CauseText: After exiting safe pulse cancellation, within the wait time of 5 seconds, encoderless actual value sensing was not able to be activated for the extended functions without selection.
A change is again made into the "safe pulse cancellation" state.

Remedy.RemedyText: - check missing enable signals, which prevent the drive control from being commissioned (r0046).
- evaluate possible fault messages of the encoderless actual value sensing and remove.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: HLA, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: SI P1 (CU): Wait for communication
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Communication error to the higher-level control system

Cause.CauseText: The drive waits for communication to be established to execute the safety-relevant motion monitoring functions.
Note:
STO is active in this state.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret decimal):
1: Wait for communication to be established to SINUMERIK.
2: Wait for communication to be established to TM54F.
3: Wait for communication to be established to PROFIsafe F-Host.

Remedy.RemedyText: If, after a longer period of time, the message is not automatically withdrawn, the following checks have to be made as appropriate:
For communication with SINUMERIK, the following applies:
- check any other PROFIBUS messages/signals present and remove their cause.
- check that assignment of the axes on the higher-level control to the drives in the drive unit is correct.
- check enable signal of the safety-relevant motion monitoring functions for the corresponding axis on the higher-level control and if required, set it.
For communication with TM54F, the following applies:
- check any other messages/signals present for DRIVE-CLiQ communication with the TM54F and remove their cause.
- check the setting of p10010. All the drive objects controlled by the TM54F must be listed.
For communication with PROFIsafe F-Host, the following applies:
- check any other PROFIsafe communication messages/signals present and evaluate them.
- check the operating state of the F-Host.
- check the communication connection to the F Host.

- check the communication connection to the Motor Module/Hydraulic Module. It must be ensured that when the Control Unit powers up, the Motor Module/Hydraulic Module is connected and at the latest is also switched-on with the Control Unit. Otherwise, if the Motor Module/Hydraulic Module is subsequently inserted or switched on, a POWER ON must be performed at the Control Unit.
Note:
STO: Safe Torque Off

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: HLA, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: SI Motion P1 (CU): Axis not safely referenced
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Safety monitoring channel has identified an error

Cause.CauseText: The standstill position saved before switching off does not match the actual position determined at switch-on.
Message value (r9749, interpret decimal):
1: Axis not safely referenced.
2: User agreement missing.

Remedy.RemedyText: If safe automatic referencing is not possible the user must issue a user agreement for the new position using the softkey. This mean that this position is then designated as safety-relevant.
Note:
SI: Safety Integrated

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: HLA, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: SI Motion P1 (CU): Test stop for motion monitoring functions running
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Safety monitoring channel has identified an error

Cause.CauseText: The forced checking procedure (test stop) for the safe motion monitoring functions is currently in progress.

Remedy.RemedyText: Not necessary.
The message is automatically withdrawn when the test stop has been completed.
Note:
SI: Safety Integrated

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: HLA, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: SI Motion P1 (CU): Acceptance test mode active
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Safety monitoring channel has identified an error

Cause.CauseText: The acceptance test mode is active.
This means the following:
- the setpoint velocity limiting is deactivated (r9733).
- the standard limit switches are deactivated during the acceptance test for function SLP (SE) (for EPOS internal, otherwise via r10234).

- for safety functions with SINUMERIK, the following applies: The POWER ON signals of the safety-relevant motion monitoring functions can be acknowledged during the acceptance test using the acknowledgment functions of the higher-level control.

Remedy.RemedyText: Not necessary.
The message is withdrawn when exiting the acceptance test mode.
Note:
SI: Safety Integrated
SLP: Safely-Limited Position / SE: Safe software limit switches

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: DRIVE-CLiQ: Hardware/configuration error
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Internal (DRIVE-CLiQ) communication error

Cause.CauseText: A DRIVE-CLiQ connection fault has occurred.
Fault value (r0949, interpret decimal):
Communication via DRIVE-CLiQ socket X100 ... X107 has not been switched to cyclic operation. The cause may be an incorrect structure or a configuration that results in an impossible bus timing.

Loss of the DRIVE-CLiQ connection. The cause may be, for example, that the DRIVE-CLiQ cable was withdrawn from the Control Unit or as a result of a short-circuit for motors with DRIVE-CLiQ. This fault can only be acknowledged in cyclic communication.
Repeated faults when detecting the connection. This fault can only be acknowledged in cyclic communication.
A connection was detected but the node ID exchange mechanism does not function. The reason is probably that the component is defective. This fault can only be acknowledged in cyclic communication.

Remedy.RemedyText: For fault value = 100 ... 107:
- ensure that the DRIVE-CLiQ components have the same firmware versions.
- avoid longer topologies for short current controller sampling times.
For fault value = 10:
- check the DRIVE-CLiQ cables at the Control Unit.
- remove any short-circuit for motors with DRIVE-CLiQ.
- carry out a POWER ON.
For fault value = 11:
- check the electrical cabinet design and cable routing for EMC compliance
For fault value = 12:
- replace the component involved.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: DRIVE-CLiQ diagnostics: cable fault to the component
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: General drive fault

Cause.CauseText: The fault counter (r9936[0...199]) to monitor the DRIVE-CLiQ connections/cables has been incremented.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret decimal):
Component number.
Note:
The component number specifies the component whose feeder cable from the direction of the Control Unit is faulted.
The alarm is automatically withdrawn after 5 seconds, assuming that no other data transfer error has occurred.

Remedy.RemedyText: - check the corresponding DRIVE-CLiQ cables.
- check the electrical cabinet design and cable routing for EMC compliance

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: SMI: Component found without motor data
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Hardware/software error

Cause.CauseText: An SMI/DQI without motor data has been found (e.g. SMI installed as replacement part).
Alarm value (r2124, interpret decimal):
Component number from target topology.

Remedy.RemedyText: 1. Download the SMI/DQI data (motor/encoder data) from the data backup again (p4690, p4691).
2. Carry out a POWER ON (switch-off/switch-on) for this component.
Note:
DQI: DRIVE-CLiQ Sensor Integrated
SMI: SINAMICS Sensor Module Integrated

RemedyParameterList.Text: p4690 (SMI spare part component number), p4691 (SMI spare part save/download data)

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, CU_LINK, CU_S_AC_DP, CU_S_AC_PN, CU_S120_DP, CU_S120_PN, CU_S150_DP, CU_S150_PN, ENC, HLA, HUB, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TB30, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM41, TM54F_MA, TM54F_SL, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: PB/PN: Configuration telegram error
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: A controller attempts to establish a connection using an incorrect configuring telegram.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret decimal):
Connection established to more drive objects than configured in the device. The drive objects for process data exchange and their sequence are defined in p0978.
Too many PZD data words for output or input to a drive object. The number of possible PZD items in a drive object is determined by the number of indices in r2050/p2051.
Uneven number of bytes for input or output.
Setting data for synchronization not accepted. For more information, see A01902.
Unknown parameterizing block.
Clock synchronization for the PZD interface set in p8815[0] is not permissible.
More than one PZD interface is operated in clock synchronism.
PN Shared Device: Illegal mixed configuration of PROFIsafe and PZD.
PN Shared Device: Illegal double assignment of a slot/subslot.
PN: Configured drive object and existing drive object do not match.
PN: configured telegram cannot be set.
Illegal PROFIsafe configuration for the interface set in p8815[1].
More than one PZD interface is operated with PROFIsafe.
PROFIsafe parameter error (e.g. F_dest).
PROFIsafe telegram does not match.
PROFIsafe connection is rejected as long as there is no isochronous connection (p8969).
Additional values:
Only for internal Siemens troubleshooting.

Remedy.RemedyText: Check the bus configuration on the master and the slave sides.
For alarm value = 1, 2:
- check the list of the drive objects with process data exchange (p0978).
Note:
With p0978[x] = 0, all of the following drive objects in the list are excluded from the process data exchange.
For alarm value = 2:
- check the number of data words for output and input to a drive object.
For alarm value = 211:
- Ensure offline version <= online version.
For alarm value = 223, 500:
- check the setting in p8839 and p8815.
- check for inserted but not configured CBE20.
- ensure that only one PZD interface is operated in clock synchronism or with PROFIsafe.
For alarm value = 255:
- check configured drive objects.
For alarm value = 256:
- check the configured telegram.
For alarm value = 501:
- check the set PROFIsafe address (p9610).
For alarm value = 502:
- check the set PROFIsafe telegram (p60022, p9611).

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: PB/PN: clock cycle synchronous operation parameterization not permissible
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: Parameterization for isochronous operation is not permissible.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret decimal):
0: Bus cycle time Tdp < 0.5 ms.
1: Bus cycle time Tdp > 32 ms.
2: Bus cycle time Tdp is not an integer multiple of the current controller sampling time.
3: Instant of the actual value sensing Ti > Bus cycle time Tdp or Ti = 0.
4: Instant of the actual value sensing Ti is not an integer multiple of the current controller sampling time.
5: Instant of the setpoint acceptance To >= Bus cycle time Tdp or To = 0.
6: Instant of the setpoint acceptance To is not an integer multiple of the current controller sampling time.
7: Master application cycle time Tmapc is not an integer multiple of the speed controller sampling time.
8: Bus reserve bus cycle time Tdp - data exchange time Tdx less than two current controller sampling times.
10: Instant of the setpoint acceptance To <= data exchange time Tdx + current controller sampling time
11: Master application cycle time Tmapc > 14 x Tdp or Tmapc = 0.
12: PLL tolerance window Tpll_w > Tpll_w_max.
13: Bus cycle time Tdp is not a multiple of all basic clock cycles p0110[x].
16: For COMM BOARD, the instant in time for the actual value sensing Ti is less than two current controller sampling times.

Remedy.RemedyText: - Adapt the bus parameterization Tdp, Ti, To.
- adapt the sampling time for the current controller or speed controller.
For alarm value = 10:
- reduce Tdx by using fewer bus participants or shorter telegrams.
Note:
PB: PROFIBUS
PN: PROFINET

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, CU_I, CU_I_D410, CU_LINK, CU_NX_CX, ENC, HLA, HUB, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TB30, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM41, TM54F_MA, TM54F_SL, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: COMM INT: Receive configuration data invalid
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: The drive unit did not accept the receive configuration data.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret decimal):
Return value of the receive configuration data check.
1: Connection established to more drive objects than configured in the device. The drive objects for process data exchange and their sequence are defined in p0978.
2: Too many PZD data words for output or input to a drive object. The number of possible PZD items in a drive object is determined by the number of indices in r2050/p2051.
3: Uneven number of bytes for input or output.
4: Setting data for synchronization not accepted. For more information, see A01902.
5: Cyclic operation not active.
501: PROFIsafe parameter error (e.g. F_dest).
Additional values:
Only for internal Siemens troubleshooting.

Remedy.RemedyText: Check the receive configuration data.
For alarm value = 1, 2:
Check the list of the drive objects with process data exchange (p0978). With p0978[x] = 0, all of the following drive objects in the list are excluded from the process data exchange.
For alarm value = 2:
Check the number of data words for output and input to a drive object.
For alarm value = 501:
Check the set PROFIsafe address (p9610).

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, ENC, HLA, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TB30, TM120, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM31, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Fieldbus: setpoint timeout
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Communication error to the higher-level control system

Cause.CauseText: The reception of setpoints from the fieldbus interface (onboard, PROFIBUS/PROFINET/USS) has been interrupted.
- bus connection interrupted.
- controller switched off.
- controller set into the STOP state.

Remedy.RemedyText: Restore the bus connection and set the controller to RUN.
Note regarding PROFIBUS slave redundancy:
For operation on a Y link, it must be ensured that "DP alarm mode = DPV1" is set in the slave parameterization.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: PB/PN: clock cycle synchronous operation clock cycle failure
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Communication error to the higher-level control system

Cause.CauseText: The global control telegram to synchronize the clock cycles has failed - in cyclic operation - for several DP clock cycles or has violated the time grid specified in the parameterizing telegram over several consecutive DP clock cycles (refer to the bus cycle time, Tdp and Tpllw).

Remedy.RemedyText: - check the physical bus configuration (cable, connector, terminating resistor, shielding, etc.).
- check whether communication was briefly or permanently interrupted.
- check the bus and controller for utilization level (e.g. bus cycle time Tdp was set too short).
Note:
PB: PROFIBUS
PN: PROFINET

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, ENC, HLA, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: PB/PN: clock cycle synchronous operation sign-of-life failure
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Communication error to the higher-level control system

Cause.CauseText: The maximum permissible number of errors in the controller sign-of-life (clock synchronous operation) has been exceeded in cyclic operation.

Remedy.RemedyText: - physically check the bus (cables, connectors, terminating resistor, shielding, etc.).
- correct the interconnection of the controller sign-of-life (p2045).
- check whether the controller correctly sends the sign-of-life (e.g. create a trace with STW2.12 ... STW2.15 and trigger signal ZSW1.3).
- check the permissible telegram failure rate (p0925).
- check the bus and controller for utilization level (e.g. bus cycle time Tdp was set too short).
Note:
PB: PROFIBUS
PN: PROFINET

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, CU_I, CU_I_D410, CU_LINK, CU_NX_CX, ENC, HLA, HUB, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TB30, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM41, TM54F_MA, TM54F_SL, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: COMM INT: Monitoring time sign-of-life expired
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Communication error to the higher-level control system

Cause.CauseText: The monitoring time for the sign-of-life counter has expired.
The connection between the drive and the higher-level control (SIMOTION, SINUMERIK) has been interrupted for the following reasons:
- the control was reset.
- the data transfer to the control was interrupted.

Remedy.RemedyText: - wait until the control has re-booted.
- restore data transfer to the control.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, CU_I, CU_I_D410, CU_LINK, CU_NX_CX, ENC, HLA, HUB, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TB30, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM41, TM54F_MA, TM54F_SL, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: COMM INT: Monitoring time configuration expired
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Communication error to the higher-level control system

Cause.CauseText: The monitoring time for the configuration has expired.
Fault value (r0949, interpret decimal):
0: The transfer time of the send configuration data has been exceeded.
1: The transfer time of the receive configuration data has been exceeded.

Remedy.RemedyText: - acknowledge faults that are present.
- carry out a POWER ON (switch-off/switch-on) for all components.
- upgrade firmware to later version.
- contact Technical Support.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: PB/PN: clock cycle synchronous operation sign-of-life failure drive object 1
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Communication error to the higher-level control system

Cause.CauseText: Group display for problems with the sign-of-life of the master (isochronous operation) on the drive object 1 (Control Unit).
For central measurements, synchronism with the central master is lost.

Remedy.RemedyText: Note:
PB: PROFIBUS
PN: PROFINET

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, CU_LINK, CU_S_AC_DP, CU_S_AC_PN, CU_S120_DP, CU_S120_PN, CU_S150_DP, CU_S150_PN, ENC, HLA, HUB, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TB30, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM41, TM54F_MA, TM54F_SL, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: PROFIBUS: Interruption cyclic connection
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Communication error to the higher-level control system

Cause.CauseText: The cyclic connection to the PROFIBUS master is interrupted.

Remedy.RemedyText: Establish the PROFIBUS connection and activate the PROFIBUS master in the cyclic mode.
Note:
If there is no communication to a higher-level control system, then p2030 should be set = 0 to suppress this message.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: PROFIBUS: Receive setpoints after To
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Communication error to the higher-level control system

Cause.CauseText: Output data of PROFIBUS master (setpoints) received at the incorrect instant in time within the PROFIBUS clock cycle.

Remedy.RemedyText: - check bus configuration.
- check parameters for clock cycle synchronization (ensure To > Tdx).
Note:
To: Time of setpoint acceptance
Tdx: Data exchange time

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: CU_S_AC_DP, CU_S_AC_PN, CU_S120_DP, CU_S120_PN, CU_S150_DP, CU_S150_PN
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Modbus TCP: connection interrupted
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Communication error to the higher-level control system

Cause.CauseText: The Ethernet connection to the Modbus controller is interrupted.

Remedy.RemedyText: - establish an Ethernet connection.
- activate the Modbus controller.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: PB/PN: current controller sampling time clock cycle synch. not equal
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: The current controller sampling time of all drives must be set the same for the clock cycle synchronous operation.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret decimal):
Number of the drive object with different current controller sampling time.

Remedy.RemedyText: Set current controller sampling time to identical values (p0115[0]).
Note:
PB: PROFIBUS
PN: PROFINET

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: PB/PN: speed controller sampling time clock cycle synch. not equal
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: The speed controller sampling time of all drives must be set the same for the clock cycle synchronous operation.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret decimal):
Number of the drive object with the different speed controller sampling time.

Remedy.RemedyText: Set the speed controller sampling times to identical values (p0115[1]).
Note:
PB: PROFIBUS
PN: PROFINET

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, ENC, HLA, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: PB/PN: clock cycle synchronization missing for DSC
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: There is no clock synchronization or clock synchronous sign of life and DSC is selected.
Note:
DSC: Dynamic Servo Control

Remedy.RemedyText: Set clock synchronization across the bus configuration and transfer clock synchronous sign-of-life.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: PB/PN: clock cycle synchronism not reached
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Communication error to the higher-level control system

Cause.CauseText: The bus is in the data exchange state and clock synchronous operation has been selected using the parameterizing telegram. It was not possible to synchronize to the clock cycle specified by the master.
- the master does not send a clock synchronous global control telegram although clock synchronous operation was selected when configuring the bus.
- the master is using another clock synchronous DP clock cycle than was transferred to the slave in the parameterizing telegram.
- at least one drive object has a pulse enable (also not controlled from PROFIBUS/PROFINET).

Remedy.RemedyText: - check the master application and bus configuration.
- check the consistency between the clock cycle input when configuring the slave and clock cycle setting at the master.
- check that no drive object has a pulse enable. Only enable the pulses after synchronizing the PROFIBUS/PROFINET drives.
Note:
PB: PROFIBUS
PN: PROFINET

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: PB/PN: clock cycle signal missing when establishing bus communication
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Communication error to the higher-level control system

Cause.CauseText: The bus is in the data exchange state and clock synchronous operation has been selected using the parameterizing telegram. The global control telegram for synchronization is not being received.

Remedy.RemedyText: Check the master application and bus configuration.
Note:
PB: PROFIBUS
PN: PROFINET

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: PB/PN: clock cycle signal error when establishing bus communication
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Communication error to the higher-level control system

Cause.CauseText: The bus is in the data exchange state and clock synchronous operation has been selected using the parameterizing telegram.
The global control telegram for synchronization is being irregularly received.
-.the master is sending an irregular global control telegram.
- the master is using another clock synchronous DP clock cycle than was transferred to the slave in the parameterizing telegram.

Remedy.RemedyText: - check the master application and bus configuration.
- check the consistency between the clock cycle input when configuring the slave and clock cycle setting at the master.
Note:
PB: PROFIBUS
PN: PROFINET

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, ENC, HLA, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: PB/PN: sign-of-life synchronism not reached
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Communication error to the higher-level control system

Cause.CauseText: The bus is in the data exchange state and clock synchronous operation has been selected using the parameterizing telegram.
Synchronization with the master sign-of-life (STW2.12 ... STW2.15) could not be completed because the sign-of-life is changing differently to how it was configured in the Tmapc time grid.

Remedy.RemedyText: - ensure that the master correctly increments the sign-of-life in the master application clock cycle Tmapc.
- correct the interconnection of the master sign-of-life (p2045).
Note:
PB: PROFIBUS
PN: PROFINET

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: PROFIBUS: Connection to the Publisher failed
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Communication error to the higher-level control system

Cause.CauseText: For PROFIBUS peer-to-peer data transfer, the connection to at least one Publisher has failed.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret binary):
Bit 0 = 1: Publisher with address in r2077[0], connection failed.
Bit 15 = 1: Publisher with address in r2077[15], connection failed.

Remedy.RemedyText: - check the PROFIBUS cables.
- carry out a first commissioning of the Publisher that has the failed connection.

RemedyParameterList.Text: r2077 (PROFIBUS diagnostics peer-to-peer data transfer addresses)

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: PROFIBUS: Connection to the Publisher aborted
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Communication error to the higher-level control system

Cause.CauseText: At this drive object, the connection to at least one Publisher for PROFIBUS peer-to-peer data transfer in cyclic operation has been aborted.
Fault value (r0949, interpret binary):
Bit 0 = 1: Publisher with address in r2077[0], connection aborted.
Bit 15 = 1: Publisher with address in r2077[15], connection aborted.

Remedy.RemedyText: - check the PROFIBUS cables.
- check the state of the Publisher that has the aborted connection.

RemedyParameterList.Text: r2077 (PROFIBUS diagnostics peer-to-peer data transfer addresses)

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: PB/PN: clock cycle synchronous operation synchronization unsuccessful
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Communication error to the higher-level control system

Cause.CauseText: Synchronization of the internal clock cycle to the global control telegram has failed. The internal clock cycle exhibits an unexpected shift.

Remedy.RemedyText: Only for internal Siemens troubleshooting.
Note:
PB: PROFIBUS
PN: PROFINET

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: CU SYNC: Synchronization application clock cycle missing
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Internal (DRIVE-CLiQ) communication error

Cause.CauseText: If DRIVE-CLiQ components with different application clock cycle are operated on a DRIVE-CLiQ port, this requires synchronization with the Control Unit. This synchronization routine was unsuccessful.
Fault value (r0949, interpret decimal):
Only for internal Siemens troubleshooting.

Remedy.RemedyText: - carry out a POWER ON (switch-off/switch-on) for all components.
- upgrade the software of the DRIVE-CLiQ components.
- upgrade the Control Unit software.
Note:
If a Controller Extension is being used (e.g. CX32, NX10), then the following applies:
Check whether the Controller Extension is issuing error messages, and if required, remove these.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: CU DRIVE-CLiQ: Synchronization of component not supported
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Internal (DRIVE-CLiQ) communication error

Cause.CauseText: The existing system configuration requires that the connected DRIVE-CLiQ components support the synchronization between the basic clock cycle, DRIVE-CLiQ clock cycle and the application clock cycle.
However, not all DRIVE-CLiQ components have this functionality.
Fault value (r0949, interpret decimal):
Component number of the first faulty DRIVE-CLiQ component.

Remedy.RemedyText: Upgrade the firmware of the component specified in the fault value.
Note:
If required, also upgrade additional components in the DRIVE-CLiQ line.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: CU SYNC: Synchronization not completed
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Internal (DRIVE-CLiQ) communication error

Cause.CauseText: After the drive system is switched on, the synchronization between the basic clock cycle, DRIVE-CLiQ clock cycle and application clock cycle was started but was not completed within the selected time tolerance.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret decimal):
Only for internal Siemens troubleshooting.

Remedy.RemedyText: Carry out a POWER ON (switch-off/switch-on) for all components.

If the error occurs after the drive sampling times were changed, and if a Terminal Module 31 (TM31) is being used, the sampling times (p0115, p4099) should be set as integer multiples to the drive clock cycles (p0115).

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: CU DRIVE-CLiQ: Synchronization unsuccessful
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Internal (DRIVE-CLiQ) communication error

Cause.CauseText: Synchronization between the basic clock cycle, DRIVE-CLiQ clock cycle and application clock cycle was started and was not able to be successfully completed (e.g. after switch-on).
Fault value (r0949, interpret decimal):
Only for internal Siemens troubleshooting.

Remedy.RemedyText: 1. Remove the cause of a possible DRIVE-CLiQ fault.
2. Initiate a new synchronization, e.g. as follows:
- remove the PROFIBUS master and re-insert again.
- restart the PROFIBUS master.
- switch off the Control Unit and switch on again.
- carry out a Control Unit hardware reset (RESET button, p0972).
- carry out a parameter reset and download the saved parameters (p0009 = 30, p0976 = 2, 3).

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: CU DRIVE-CLiQ: Synchronization DO not completed
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Internal (DRIVE-CLiQ) communication error

Cause.CauseText: After the drive system is switched on, the synchronization between the basic clock cycle, DRIVE-CLiQ clock cycle and application clock cycle was started but was not completed within the selected time tolerance.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret decimal):
Only for internal Siemens troubleshooting.

Remedy.RemedyText: Carry out a POWER ON (switch-off/switch-on) for all components of the DO.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, CU_LINK, CU_S120_DP, CU_S120_PN, CU_S150_DP, CU_S150_PN, ENC, HLA, HUB, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TB30, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM41, TM54F_MA, TM54F_SL, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: CBE25: cyclic connection interrupted
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Communication error to the higher-level control system

Cause.CauseText: The cyclic connection to the PROFINET controller is interrupted.

Remedy.RemedyText: Establish the PROFINET connection and activate the PROFINET controller in the cyclic mode.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, CU_LINK, CU_S120_DP, CU_S120_PN, CU_S150_DP, CU_S150_PN, ENC, HLA, HUB, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TB30, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM41, TM54F_MA, TM54F_SL, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: CBE2x: maximum number of controllers exceeded
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: A controller attempts to establish a connection to the drive, and as a consequence exceeds the permitted number of PROFINET connections.
The alarm is automatically withdrawn after approx. 30 seconds.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret hexadecimal):
yyyyxxxx hex: yyyy = info. 1, xxxx = info. 2
Info 1 = 0: number of RT connections exceeded
Info 1 > 0: number of IRT connections exceeded
Info 2: permitted number of connections

Remedy.RemedyText: Check the configuration of the PROFINET controllers.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, CU_LINK, CU_S120_DP, CU_S120_PN, CU_S150_DP, CU_S150_PN, ENC, HLA, HUB, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TB30, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM41, TM54F_MA, TM54F_SL, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: CBE2x: internal error for cyclic data transfer
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Communication error to the higher-level control system

Cause.CauseText: The cyclic actual values and/or setpoints were not transferred within the specified times.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret hexadecimal):
Only for internal Siemens troubleshooting.

Remedy.RemedyText: Correctly set T_io_input or T_io_output.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, CU_LINK, CU_S_AC_DP, CU_S_AC_PN, CU_S120_DP, CU_S120_PN, CU_S150_DP, CU_S150_PN, ENC, HLA, HUB, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TB30, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM41, TM54F_MA, TM54F_SL, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: PN: cyclic connection interrupted
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Communication error to the higher-level control system

Cause.CauseText: The cyclic connection to the PROFINET controller is interrupted.

Remedy.RemedyText: Establish the PROFINET connection and activate the PROFINET controller in the cyclic mode.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, CU_LINK, CU_S_AC_DP, CU_S_AC_PN, CU_S120_DP, CU_S120_PN, CU_S150_DP, CU_S150_PN, ENC, HLA, HUB, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TB30, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM41, TM54F_MA, TM54F_SL, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: PN: Maximum number of controllers exceeded
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: A controller attempts to establish a connection to the drive, and as a consequence exceeds the permitted number of PROFINET connections.
The alarm is automatically withdrawn after approx. 30 seconds.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret hexadecimal):
yyyyxxxx hex: yyyy = info. 1, xxxx = info. 2
Info 1 = 0: number of RT connections exceeded
Info 1 > 0: number of IRT connections exceeded
Info 2: permitted number of connections

Remedy.RemedyText: Check the configuration of the PROFINET controllers.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, CU_LINK, CU_S_AC_DP, CU_S_AC_PN, CU_S120_DP, CU_S120_PN, CU_S150_DP, CU_S150_PN, ENC, HLA, HUB, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TB30, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM41, TM54F_MA, TM54F_SL, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: PN: second controller missing
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: Connections to two PROFINET controllers are expected. However, only the connection to a PROFINET controller is present.
- system redundancy is activated.

Remedy.RemedyText: Check the configuration of the PROFINET controllers.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, CU_LINK, CU_S_AC_DP, CU_S_AC_PN, CU_S120_DP, CU_S120_PN, CU_S150_DP, CU_S150_PN, ENC, HLA, HUB, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TB30, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM41, TM54F_MA, TM54F_SL, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: PN: system redundancy switchover running
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: The "PROFINET system redundancy" function is configured and the connection between the primary control and drive device is interrupted. The backup controller assumes control of the drive device.

Remedy.RemedyText: Not necessary.
This alarm is automatically withdrawn after switchover has been completed.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, CU_LINK, CU_S_AC_DP, CU_S_AC_PN, CU_S120_DP, CU_S120_PN, CU_S150_DP, CU_S150_PN, ENC, HLA, HUB, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TB30, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM41, TM54F_MA, TM54F_SL, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: PN: internal cyclic data transfer error
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Communication error to the higher-level control system

Cause.CauseText: The cyclic actual values and/or setpoints were not transferred within the specified times.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret hexadecimal):
Only for internal Siemens troubleshooting.

Remedy.RemedyText: Correctly set T_io_input or T_io_output.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, CU_LINK, CU_S_AC_DP, CU_S_AC_PN, CU_S120_DP, CU_S120_PN, CU_S150_DP, CU_S150_PN, ENC, HLA, HUB, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TB30, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM41, TM54F_MA, TM54F_SL, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: USS: PZD configuration error
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: The configuration of the process data (PZD) for the USS protocol is incorrect.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret decimal):
2: PZD amount (p2022) too great for the first drive object (p978[0]).
The number of possible PZD items in a drive object is determined by the number of indices in r2050/p2051.

Remedy.RemedyText: For alarm value = 2:
Check the amount of USS PZD (p2022) and the maximum PZD amount (r2050/p2051) for the first drive object (p0978[0]).

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Function generator: Start not possible
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: The function generator has already been started.

Remedy.RemedyText: Stop the function generator and restart again if necessary.
Note:
The alarm is reset as follows:
- remove the cause of this alarm.
- restart the function generator.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Function generator: Drive does not exist
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: The drive object specified for connection does not exist.

Remedy.RemedyText: Use the existing drive object with the corresponding number.
Note:
The alarm is reset as follows:
- remove the cause of this alarm.
- restart the function generator.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Function generator: No drive specified for connection
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: No drive specified for connection in p4815.

Remedy.RemedyText: At least one drive to be connected must be specified in p4815.
Note:
The alarm is reset as follows:
- remove the cause of this alarm.
- restart the function generator.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Function generator: Drive not SERVO / VECTOR / DC_CTRL
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: The drive object specified for connection is not a SERVO / VECTOR or DC_CTRL.

Remedy.RemedyText: Use a SERVO / VECTOR / DC_CTRL drive object with the corresponding number.
Note:
The alarm is reset as follows:
- remove the cause of this alarm.
- restart the function generator.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Function generator: Drive specified a multiple number of times
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: The drive object specified for connection is already specified.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret decimal):
Drive object number of the drive object that is specified a multiple number of times.

Remedy.RemedyText: Specify a different drive object.
Note:
The alarm is reset as follows:
- remove the cause of this alarm.
- restart the function generator.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Function generator: Illegal mode
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: The set operating mode (p1300) of the drive object is not permissible when using the function generator.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret decimal):
Number of the drive object involved.

Remedy.RemedyText: Change the operating mode for this drive object to p1300 = 20 (encoderless speed control) or p1300 = 21 (speed control with encoder).
Note:
The alarm is reset as follows:
- remove the cause of this alarm.
- restart the function generator.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Function generator: Speed setpoint from the drive is not zero
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: The speed setpoint of a drive selected for connection is greater than the value for the standstill detection set using p1226.

Remedy.RemedyText: For all of the drives specified for connection, set the speed setpoints to zero.
Note:
The alarm is reset as follows:
- remove the cause of this alarm.
- restart the function generator.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, CU_I, CU_I_D410, CU_LINK, CU_NX_CX, CU_S_AC_DP, CU_S_AC_PN, CU_S120_DP, CU_S120_PN, CU_S150_DP, CU_S150_PN, ENC, HLA, HUB, R_INF, S_INF, TB30, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM54F_MA, TM54F_SL, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Function generator: The actual drive speed is not zero
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: The speed actual value of a drive selected for connection is greater than the value for the standstill detection set using p1226.

Remedy.RemedyText: Set the relevant drives to zero speed before starting the function generator.
Note:
The alarm is reset as follows:
- remove the cause of this alarm.
- restart the function generator.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Function generator: Drive enable signals missing
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: The master control and/or enable signals are missing to connect to the specified drive.

Remedy.RemedyText: Fetch the master control to the specified drive object and set all enable signals.
Note:
The alarm is reset as follows:
- remove the cause of this alarm.
- restart the function generator.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Function generator: Magnetizing running
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: Magnetizing has not yet been completed on a drive object specified for connection.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret decimal):
Number of the drive object involved.

Remedy.RemedyText: Wait for magnetizing of the motor (r0056.4).
Note:
The alarm is reset as follows:
- restart the function generator.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Function generator: Parameter cannot be changed
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: This parameter setting cannot be changed when the function generator is active (p4800 = 1).

Remedy.RemedyText: - stop the function generator before parameterizing (p4800 = 0).
- if required, start the function generator (p4800 = 1).
Note:
The alarm is reset as follows:
- remove the cause of this alarm.
- restart the function generator.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, CU_I, CU_I_D410, CU_LINK, CU_NX_CX, CU_S_AC_DP, CU_S_AC_PN, CU_S120_DP, CU_S120_PN, CU_S150_DP, CU_S150_PN, ENC, HLA, HUB, R_INF, S_INF, TB30, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM54F_MA, TM54F_SL, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Function generator: Period too short
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: The value for the period is too short.

Remedy.RemedyText: Check and adapt the value for the period.
Note:
The alarm is reset as follows:
- remove the cause of this alarm.
- restart the function generator.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Function generator: Pulse width too high
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: The selected pulse width is too high.
The pulse width must be less than the period duration.

Remedy.RemedyText: Reduce pulse width.
Note:
The alarm is reset as follows:
- remove the cause of this alarm.
- restart the function generator.

RemedyParameterList.Text: p4821 (Function generator period), p4822 (Function generator pulse width)

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Function generator: Physical address equals zero
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: The specified physical address is zero.

Remedy.RemedyText: Set a physical address with a value other than zero.
Note:
The alarm is reset as follows:
- remove the cause of this alarm.
- restart the function generator.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Function generator: Illegal value for offset
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: The value for the offset is higher than the value for the upper limit or lower than the value for the lower limit.

Remedy.RemedyText: Adjust the offset value accordingly.
Note:
The alarm is reset as follows:
- remove the cause of this alarm.
- restart the function generator.

RemedyParameterList.Text: p4826 (Function generator offset), p4828 (Function generator lower limit), p4829 (Function generator upper limit)

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Function generator: Illegal value for bandwidth
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: The bandwidth referred to the time slice clock cycle of the function generator has either been set too low or too high.
Depending on the time slice clock cycle, the bandwidth is defined as follows:
Bandwidth_max = 1 / (2 x time slice clock cycle)
Bandwidth_min = Bandwidth_max / 100000
Example:
Assumption: p4830 = 125 s
--> Bandwidth_max = 1 / (2 x 125 s) = 4000 Hz
--> Bandwidth_min = 4000 Hz / 100000 = 0.04 Hz
Note:
p4823: Function generator bandwidth
p4830: Function generator time slice clock cycle

CauseParameterList.Text: p4823 (Function generator bandwidth), p4830 (Function generator time slice cycle)

Remedy.RemedyText: Check the value for the bandwidth and adapt accordingly.
Note:
The alarm is reset as follows:
- remove the cause of this alarm.
- restart the function generator.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Function generator: Time slice clock cycle invalid
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: The time slice clock cycle selected does not match any of the existing time slices.

Remedy.RemedyText: Enter an existing time slice clock cycle. The existing time slices can be read out via p7901.
Note:
The alarm is reset as follows:
- remove the cause of this alarm.
- restart the function generator.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Trace: Start not possible
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: The trace has already been started.

Remedy.RemedyText: Stop the trace and, if necessary, start again.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Trace: recording not possible as a result of know-how protection
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: TRACE recording is not possible as at least one signal or trigger signal being used is under know-how protection.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret hexadecimal):
bbbbaaaa hex:
aaaa = 1: recorder 0
aaaa = 2: recorder 1
aaaa = 3: recorders 0 and 1
bbbb = parameter number (hexadecimal), that was not able to be written to.

Remedy.RemedyText: - Temporarily activate or deactivate know-how protection (p7766).
- include the signal in the OEM exception list (p7763, p7764).
- Where relevant do not record the signal.

RemedyParameterList.Text: p7763 (KHP OEM exception list number of indices for p7764), p7764 (KHP OEM exception list)

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Trace: Recording time too short
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: The trace duration is too short.
The minimum is twice the value of the trace clock cycle.

Remedy.RemedyText: Check the selected recording time and, if necessary, adjust.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Trace: Recording cycle too short
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: The selected recording cycle is shorter than the selected basic clock cycle 0 (p0110[0]).

Remedy.RemedyText: Increase the value for the trace cycle.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Trace: Time slice clock cycle invalid
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: The time slice clock cycle selected does not match any of the existing time slices.

Remedy.RemedyText: Enter an existing time slice clock cycle. The existing time slices can be read out via p7901.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Trace: Time slice clock cycle for endless trace not valid
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: The selected time slice clock cycle cannot be used for the endless trace

Remedy.RemedyText: Enter the clock cycle of an existing time slice with a cycle time >= 2 ms for up to 4 recording channels or >= 4 ms from 5 recording channels per trace.
The existing time slices can be read out via p7901.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Trace: Time slice clock cycle for 2 x 8 recording channels not valid
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: The selected time slice clock cycle cannot be used for more than 4 recording channels.

Remedy.RemedyText: Enter the clock cycle of an existing time slice with a cycle time >= 4 ms or reduce the number of recording channels to 4 per trace.
The existing time slices can be read out via p7901.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Trace: Signal to be traced missing
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: - a signal to be traced was not specified.
- the specified signals are not valid.

CauseParameterList.Text: p4730 (Trace record signal 0), p4731 (Trace record signal 1), p4732 (Trace record signal 2), p4733 (Trace record signal 3)

Remedy.RemedyText: - specify the signal to be traced.
- check whether the relevant signal can be traced.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, CU_I, CU_I_D410, CU_LINK, CU_NX_CX, CU_S_AC_DP, CU_S_AC_PN, CU_S120_DP, CU_S120_PN, CU_S150_DP, CU_S150_PN, ENC, HLA, HUB, R_INF, S_INF, TB30, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM54F_MA, TM54F_SL, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Trace: Invalid signal
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: - the specified signal does not exist.
- the specified signal can no longer be traced (recorded).

CauseParameterList.Text: p4730 (Trace record signal 0), p4731 (Trace record signal 1), p4732 (Trace record signal 2), p4733 (Trace record signal 3)

Remedy.RemedyText: - specify the signal to be traced.
- check whether the relevant signal can be traced.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Trace: Invalid trigger signal
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: - a trigger signal was not specified.
- the specified signal does not exist.
- the specified signal is not a fixed-point signal.
- the specified signal cannot be used as a trigger signal for the trace.

Remedy.RemedyText: Specify a valid trigger signal.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Trace: Invalid data type
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: The specified data type to select a signal using a physical address is invalid.

CauseParameterList.Text: p4711 (Trace trigger signal), p4730 (Trace record signal 0), p4731 (Trace record signal 1), p4732 (Trace record signal 2), p4733 (Trace record signal 3)

Remedy.RemedyText: Use a valid data type.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Trace: Parameter cannot be changed
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: The trace parameter settings cannot be changed when the trace is active.

Remedy.RemedyText: - stop the trace before parameterization.
- if required, start the trace.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Trace: Pretrigger time too long
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: The selected pretrigger time must be shorter than the trace time.

CauseParameterList.Text: p4721 (Trace recording time), p4722 (Trace trigger delay)

Remedy.RemedyText: Check the pretrigger time setting and change if necessary.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Trace: Parameterization deleted due to unit changeover
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: The trace parameterization in the drive unit was deleted due to a unit changeover or a change in the reference parameters.

Remedy.RemedyText: Restart trace.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: HLA, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Message function: Parameterization error
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: A parameterization error was identified when starting the variable message function.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret decimal):
yyxxxx dec: yy = index, xxxx = parameter

Remedy.RemedyText: Correct the parameter and restart.
Note:
The alarm is automatically withdrawn when stopping, or when successfully starting the variable message function.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: MTrace 0: multiple trace cannot be activated
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: The following functions or settings are not permissible in conjunction with a multiple trace (trace recorder 0):
- measuring function
- long-time trace
- trigger condition "immediate recording start" (IMMEDIATE)
- trigger condition "start with function generator" (FG_START)

Remedy.RemedyText: - if required, deactivate the multiple trace (p4840[0] = 0).
- deactivate function or setting that is not permissible

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: MTrace 0: cannot be saved
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: It is not possible to save the measurement results of a multiple trace on the memory card (trace recorder 0).
A multiple trace is not started or is canceled.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret decimal):
1: Memory card cannot be accessed.
- card is not inserted or is blocked by a mounted USB drive.
3: data save operation to slow.
- a second trace has been completed before the measurement results of the first trace were able to be saved.
- writing the measurement result files to the card is blocked by the parameter save.
4: Data save operation canceled.
- for instance, the file required for the data save operation was not able to be found.

Remedy.RemedyText: - insert or remove the memory card.
- use a larger memory card.
- configure a longer trace time or use an endless trace.
- avoid saving parameters while a multiple trace is running.
- check whether other functions are presently accessing measurement result files.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: MTrace 1: multiple trace cannot be activated
