Cause.CauseText: One of the filter natural frequencies is greater than the Shannon frequency.
The Shannon frequency is calculated according to the following formula: 0.5 / p0115[1]
Fault value (r0949, interpret binary):
Bit 0: Filter 1 (p1417, p1419)
Bit 1: Filter 2 (p1423, p1425)
Bit 4: Actual value filter (p1447, p1449)
Bit 8 ... 15: Data set number (starting from zero)

Remedy.RemedyText: - reduce the numerator or denominator natural frequency of the speed setpoint filter involved.
- reduce the speed controller sampling time (p0115[1]).
- switch off the filter involved (p1413, p1414).

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: HLA, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Drive: Reference model natural frequency > Shannon frequency
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: The natural filter frequency of the PT2 element for the reference model (p1433) is greater than the Shannon frequency.
The Shannon frequency is calculated according to the following formula: 0.5 / p0115[1]

Remedy.RemedyText: - reduce the natural frequency of PT2 element for reference model (p1433).
- reduce the speed controller sampling time (p0115[1]).

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Drive: APC filter natural frequency > Shannon frequency
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: One of the filter natural frequencies is greater than the Shannon frequency.
The Shannon frequency is calculated according to the following formula: 0.5 / (p0115[1] * x)
Fault value (r0949, interpret binary):
Bit 16 ... 32: Data set number (starting from zero)

Remedy.RemedyText: - reduce the numerator or denominator natural frequency of the filter involved.
- reduce the speed controller sampling time (p0115[1]) or the sub-sampling (p3706, p3707).
- switch out the filter involved (p3704).

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Drive: Operating condition for APC not valid
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Application/technological function faulted

Cause.CauseText: The APC function (Advanced Positioning Control) has identified an invalid operating condition.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret binary):
Bit 0 = 1:
APC is operating without encoder
Bit 1 = 1:
Possible causes:
- the load measuring system for APC, selected using p3701, has a fault.
- the load measuring system selected using p3701 is in the park state (r0481[0...2].14).
The APC function is disabled.
Bit 2 = 1:
Possible causes:
- the load measuring system for APC, selected using p3701, has a fault.
- the load measuring system selected using p3701 is in the park state (r0481[0...2].14).
The pulse de-coupling is disabled, i.e. the speed of the motor measuring system is used as speed for the closed-loop motor speed control.

Remedy.RemedyText: For bit 0:
Only use the APC function in operation with an encoder.
For bit 1, 2:
Check the load measuring system.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Drive: APC monitoring time for speed limit expired
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Application/technological function faulted

Cause.CauseText: The limit value (p3778) for the speed/velocity was exceeded for a time longer than that set in the monitoring time (p3779).
Note:
APC: Advanced Positioning Control

Remedy.RemedyText: - check the measured value.
- check the limit value and monitoring time (p3778, p3779).

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Technology controller actual value limited
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Application/technological function faulted

Cause.CauseText: The actual value for the technology controller, interconnected via connector input p2264, has reached a limit.
Fault value (r0949, interpret decimal):
1: upper limit reached.
2: lower limit reached.

Remedy.RemedyText: - adapt the limits to the signal level (p2267, p2268).
- check the actual value normalization (p0595, p0596).
- Deactivate evaluation of the limits (p2252.3)

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Technology controller parameterizing error
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: The technology controller has a parameterizing error.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret decimal):
The upper output limit in p2291 is set lower than the lower output limit in p2292.

Remedy.RemedyText: For alarm value = 1:
Set the output limit in p2291 higher than in p2292.

RemedyParameterList.Text: p2291 (Technology controller maximum limiting), p2292 (Technology controller minimum limiting)

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: HLA, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Drive: DSC without encoder not possible
SINAMICSAlarm.ShortName: Drv: DSC w/o enc not poss
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: The function DSC (Dynamic Servo Control) was activated although there is no encoder.

CauseParameterList.Text: p1191 (DSC position controller gain KPC), p1192 (DSC encoder selection)

Remedy.RemedyText: Check the encoder selection configuration (p1192).
Note:
If there is no encoder and connector input p1191 (DSC position controller gain) is interconnected, then connector input p1191 must have a 0 signal.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Drive: Changeover to open-loop torque controlled operation not possible
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Application/technological function faulted

Cause.CauseText: For encoderless operation, the converter cannot change over to closed-loop torque-controlled operation (BI: p1501).

Remedy.RemedyText: Do not attempt to cover over to closed-loop torque-controlled operation.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Drive: Changeover to encoderless operation not possible
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Application/technological function faulted

Cause.CauseText: For closed-loop torque control, the converter cannot change over to encoderless operation (p1404).

Remedy.RemedyText: Do not attempt to change over to encoderless operation.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Drive: Motor without overvoltage protection
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: In the case of a fault at maximum speed, the motor can generate an overvoltage that can destroy the drive system.
Fault value (r0949, interpret hexadecimal):
Associated Drive Data Set (DDS).

Remedy.RemedyText: Overvoltage protection can be implemented in the following ways:
1. Limit the maximum speed (p1082) without any additional protection.
The maximum speed without protection is calculated as follows:
Rotary synchronous motors: p1082 [rpm] <= 11.695 * r0297/p0316 [Nm/A]
Linear motors: p1082 [m/min] <= 73.484 * r0297/p0316 [N/A]
Rotary synchronous motor connected to the high-frequency converter:
Linear motor connected to the high-frequency converter:
Rotary induction motor connected to the high-frequency converter:
2. Use a Voltage Protection Module (VPM) in conjunction with the function "Safe Torque Off" (p9601, p9801 only for synchronous motors).
When using a synchronous motor with VPM at the high-frequency converter, the following must apply:

When a fault condition exists, the VPM short-circuits the motors. During the short-circuit, the pulses must be suppressed - this means that the terminals for the function "Safe Torque Off" (STO) must be connected to the VPM.
When using a VPM, p0643 must be set to 1.
3. Activate the internal voltage protection (p1231 = 3, only for synchronous motors).
In so doing, the following hardware preconditions must be fulfilled:

- the infeed of the group must be capable of energy recovery (Active Line Module, Smart Line Module), and the energy recovery power of the infeed must not be less than the maximum utilized S1 power of the synchronous motor.

- For Control Unit and infeed, a 24 V power supply other than that for the Motor Module must be used with the voltage protection activated. The 24 V power supply of this Motor Module must be DC link buffered (e.g. CSM).
- a Braking Module with a correspondingly configured braking resistor must be available at the DC link.
- the synchronous motor must be short-circuit proof.

RemedyParameterList.Text: p0643 (Overvoltage protection for synchronous motors), p1231 (Armature short-circuit / DC braking configuration)

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Drive: Closed-loop control with encoder is not possible as the encoder has not been unparked
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Actual position/speed value incorrect or not available

Cause.CauseText: The changeover to closed-loop control with encoder is not possible as the encoder has not been unparked.

Remedy.RemedyText: - check whether the encoder firmware supports the "parking" function (r0481.6 = 1).
- upgrade the firmware.
Note:
For long-stator motors (p3870.0 = 1), the following applies:

The encoder must have completed the unparking procedure (r3875.0 = 1) before a changeover can be made to closed-loop control with encoder. The encoder is unparked using binector input p3876 = 0/1 signal and remains until a 0 signal in this state.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Drive: It is not possible to change the direction of rotation with the pulses enabled
SINAMICSAlarm.ShortName: Drv: Dir of rot chg n poss
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Application/technological function faulted

Cause.CauseText: A drive data set was selected - with the pulses enabled - which has a different parameterized direction of rotation (p1821).
It is only possible to change the motor direction of rotation using p1821 when the pulses are inhibited.

Remedy.RemedyText: - change over the drive data set with the pulses inhibited.
- ensure that the changeover to a drive data set does not result in the motor direction of rotation being changed (i.e. for these drive data sets, the same value must be in p1821).

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: HLA, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Drive: Setting the ramp-function generator for sensorless vector control
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Application/technological function faulted

Cause.CauseText: During operation with sensorless vector control (r1407.1) the ramp-function generator was stopped (p1141) or bypassed (p1122). An internal setting command of the ramp-function generator output caused the set setpoint speed to be frozen or was not able to be realized.
The drive is switched-on with flying restart activated (p1200), and at the same time the ramp-function generator is bypassed (p1122).

Remedy.RemedyText: - deactivate the holding command for the ramp-function generator (p1141).
- do not bypass the ramp-function generator (p1122).
- suppress the fault (p2101, p2119). This is necessary if the ramp-function generator is held using jogging and the speed setpoint is simultaneously inhibited (r0898.6).
Note:

For sensorless vector control it is not practical to read in the main setpoint of the speed control via p1155 or p1160 (p0922). In this case, the main setpoint should be injected before the ramp-function generator (p1070). The reason for this is that the ramp-function generator output is automatically set when transitioning from closed-loop speed controlled into open-loop speed controlled operation.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: HLA, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Drive: Function not supported
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: The power unit does not support the selected function.
Fault value (r0949, interpret decimal):
The function "Current controller dynamic response higher" is selected (p1810.11 = 1), however, this is not supported by the power unit (r0192.27 = 0).
- firmware of the booksize power unit is not up-to-date.
- blocksize power unit was used.
The function "Current controller dynamic response higher" is selected (p1810.11 = 1), however, this is not supported by the safety technology without encoder (9506 = 1, 3).
The function "DC link voltage compensation in the power unit" is selected (p1810.1 = 1), however, this is not supported by the power unit (r0192.28 = 0).

Remedy.RemedyText: For fault value = 1:
- if necessary, upgrade the firmware of the booksize power unit to a later version (version >= 4.4).
Note:
If the firmware has already been automatically upgraded, then only a POWER ON (switch-off/switch-on) is required.
- Use a booksize power unit (version >= 4.4).
For fault value = 2:

- if an encoder with Safety position actual values sensing is available (r0458[0...2].19 = 1), reparameterize the encoderless safety technology (p9506 = 1, 3) to safety technology with encoder (p9506 = 0).
For fault value = 1, 2:
- Deselect the function "Current controller dynamics higher" (p1810.11 = 0) and if required, set the current, speed and position controller again or calculate (p0340 = 4).
For fault value = 3:
- if necessary, upgrade the firmware of the blocksize power unit to a later version (version >= 4.6).
- deselect the "DC link voltage compensation in the power unit" function (p1810.1 = 0).

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: EPOS: Jerk time is limited
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: The calculation of the jerk time Tr = max(p2572, p2573) / p2574 resulted in an excessively high value so that the jerk time is internally limited to 1000 ms.
Note:
The alarm is also output if jerk limiting is not active.

Remedy.RemedyText: - increase the jerk limiting (p2574).
- reduce maximum acceleration or maximum deceleration (p2572, p2573).

RemedyParameterList.Text: p2572 (EPOS maximum acceleration), p2573 (EPOS maximum deceleration), p2574 (EPOS jerk limiting)

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: LR: Save the position offset of the absolute encoder adjustment
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: The status of the absolute encoder adjustment has changed.
In order to permanently save the determined position offset (p2525) and the determined number of the drive data set (p2733), they must be saved in a non-volatile fashion (p0971, p0977).
Possible causes:
- motor or encoder were replaced (applies to EQN and DQI).
- position-relevant parameters were changed.
- an encoder that was not adjusted was adjusted (save the project in a non-volatile fashion using "Copy RAM to ROM").
Note:
This message is not output when switching-on the axis after having first moved it in the switched-off state, as long as the parameterizable monitoring window was not exited.

Remedy.RemedyText: Readjust the encoder.

RemedyParameterList.Text: p2507 (LR absolute encoder adjustment status), p2525 (LR encoder adjustment offset)

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: LR: Multiturn does not match the modulo range
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: The ratio between the multiturn resolution and the modulo range (p2576) is not an integer number.
This results in the adjustment being set back, as the position actual value cannot be reproduced after switch-off/switch-on.

Remedy.RemedyText: Make the ration between the multiturn resolution and the modulo range an integer number.
The ratio v is calculated as follows:
1. Motor encoder without position tracking
2. Motor encoder with position tracking for the measuring gear
3. Motor encoder with position tracking for the load gear
4. Motor encoder with position tracking for the load and measuring gear
5. Direct encoder without position tracking
6. Direct encoder with position tracking for the measuring gear
Note:
With position tracking, it is recommended that p0412 and p2721 are changed

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: LR: Reference point coordinate not in the permissible range
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: The reference point coordinate received when adjusting the encoder via connector input p2599 lies outside the half of the encoder range and cannot be set as actual axis position.
Fault value (r0949, interpret decimal):
Maximum permissible value for the reference point coordinate.

Remedy.RemedyText: Set the reference point coordinate to a lower value than specified in the fault value.

RemedyParameterList.Text: p2598 (EPOS reference point coordinate signal source), p2599 (EPOS reference point coordinate value)

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Load gear: Position tracking cannot be reset
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Application/technological function faulted

Cause.CauseText: The position tracking cannot be reset.

Remedy.RemedyText: Reset the position tracking as follows:
- select encoder commissioning (p0010 = 4).
- reset position tracking, position (p2720.2 = 1).
- deselect encoder commissioning (p0010 = 0).
Then acknowledge the fault and, if necessary, re-adjust the absolute encoder (p2507).

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: HLA, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Load gear: Position tracking, maximum actual value exceeded
SINAMICSAlarm.AddInfo: Component number: %1, encoder data set: %2, drive data set: %3
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Application/technological function faulted

Cause.CauseText: When the position tracking of the load gear is configured, the drive/encoder (motor encoder) identifies a maximum possible absolute position actual value (r2723) that can no longer be represented within 32 bits.
Maximum value: p0408 * p2721 * 2^p0419
Fault value (r0949, interpret hexadecimal):
ccbbaa hex
aa = encoder data set
bb = component number
cc = drive data set

CauseParameterList.Text: p0408, p0419 (Fine resolution absolute value Gx_XIST2 (in bits)), p2721 (Load gear rotary absolute encoder revolutions virtual)

Remedy.RemedyText: - reduce the fine resolution (p0419).
- reduce the multiturn resolution (p2721).

RemedyParameterList.Text: p0419 (Fine resolution absolute value Gx_XIST2 (in bits)), p2721 (Load gear rotary absolute encoder revolutions virtual)

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, ENC, HLA, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Load gear: Position tracking, linear axis has exceeded the maximum range
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Application/technological function faulted

Cause.CauseText: For a configured linear axis/no modulo axis, the currently effective motor encoder (encoder 1) has exceeded the maximum possible traversing range.
For the configured linear axis, the maximum traversing range is defined to be 64x (+/- 32x) of p0421. It should be read in p2721 and interpreted as the number of load revolutions.
Note:

Only the motor encoder in the currently effective drive data set is monitored here. The actual effective drive data set is displayed in x = r0051 and the corresponding motor encoder is specified in in p0187[x].

Remedy.RemedyText: The fault should be resolved as follows:
- select encoder commissioning (p0010 = 4).
- reset position tracking, position (p2720.2 = 1).
- deselect encoder commissioning (p0010 = 0).
The fault should then be acknowledged and the absolute encoder adjusted.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, ENC, HLA, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Load gear: Position tracking actual position outside tolerance window
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Application/technological function faulted

Cause.CauseText: When switched off, the currently effective motor encoder was moved through a distance greater than was parameterized in the tolerance window. It is possible that there is no longer any reference between the mechanical system and encoder.
Note:

Only the motor encoder in the currently effective drive data set is monitored here. The actual effective drive data set is displayed in x = r0051 and the corresponding motor encoder is specified in in p0187[x].
Fault value (r0949, interpret decimal):
Deviation (difference) to the last encoder position in increments of the absolute value after the measuring gear - if one is being used. The sign designates the traversing direction.
Note:
The deviation (difference) found is also displayed in r2724.

CauseParameterList.Text: p2722 (Load gear position tracking tolerance window), r2724 (Load gear position difference)

Remedy.RemedyText: Reset the position tracking as follows:
- select encoder commissioning (p0010 = 4).
- reset position tracking, position (p2720.2 = 1).
- deselect encoder commissioning (p0010 = 0).
The fault should then be acknowledged and, if necessary, the absolute encoder adjusted (p2507).

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: LR: Standstill monitoring has responded
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Application/technological function faulted

Cause.CauseText: After the standstill monitoring time (p2543) expired, the drive left the standstill window (p2542).
- position actual value inversion incorrectly set (p0410).
- standstill window set too small (p2542).
- standstill monitoring time set too low (p2543).
- position loop gain too low (p2538).
- position loop gain too high (instability/oscillation, p2538).
- mechanical overload.
- Connecting cable, motor/drive converter incorrect (phase missing, interchanged).
- when selecting motor identification, select tracking mode (BI: p2655[0] = 1 signal).
- when selecting function generator, select tracking mode (BI: p2655[0] = 1 signal) and deactivate position control (BI:p2550 = 0 signal).

Remedy.RemedyText: Check the causes and resolve.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: LR: Position monitoring has responded
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Application/technological function faulted

Cause.CauseText: When the position monitoring time (p2545) expired, the drive had still not reached the positioning window (p2544).
- positioning window parameterized too small (p2544).
- position monitoring time parameterized too short (p2545).
- position loop gain too low (p2538).
- position loop gain too high (instability/oscillation, p2538).
- drive mechanically locked.

Remedy.RemedyText: Check the causes and resolve.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: LR: Following error too high
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Application/technological function faulted

Cause.CauseText: The difference between the position setpoint position actual value (following error dynamic model, r2563) is higher than the tolerance (p2546).
- the drive torque or accelerating capacity exceeded.
- position measuring system fault.
- encoder cable interrupted.
- position control sense incorrect.
- mechanical system locked.
- excessively high traversing velocity or excessively high position reference value (setpoint) differences

Remedy.RemedyText: Check the causes and resolve.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: LR: Position actual value preprocessing error
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Application/technological function faulted

Cause.CauseText: An error has occurred during the position actual value preprocessing.

Remedy.RemedyText: Check the encoder for the position actual value preprocessing.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: LR: Position actual value preprocessing does not have a valid encoder
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: One of the following problems has occurred with the position actual value preprocessing:
- an encoder is not assigned for the position actual value preprocessing (p2502 = 0).
- an encoder is assigned, but no encoder data set (p0187 = 99 or p0188 = 99 or p0189 = 99).
- an encoder an an encoder data set have been assigned, however, the encoder data set does not contain any encoder data (p0400 = 0) or invalid data (e.g. p0408 = 0).

Remedy.RemedyText: Check the drive data sets, encoder data sets and encoder assignment.

RemedyParameterList.Text: p0187 (Encoder 1 encoder data set number), p0188 (Encoder 2 encoder data set number), p0189 (Encoder 3 encoder data set number), p0400 (Encoder type selection), p2502 (LR encoder assignment)

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: EPOS: Maximum velocity limited
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: The maximum velocity (p2571) is too high to correctly calculate the modulo correction.
Within the sampling time for positioning (p0115[5]), with the maximum velocity, a maximum of the half modulo length must be moved through. p2571 was limited to this value.

Remedy.RemedyText: - reduce the maximum velocity (p2571).
- increase the sampling time for positioning (p0115[5]).

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: EPOS: Setpoint velocity limited
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Application/technological function faulted

Cause.CauseText: The actual setpoint velocity is greater than the parameterized maximum velocity (p2571) and is therefore limited.

Remedy.RemedyText: - check the entered setpoint velocity.
- reduce the velocity override (CI: p2646).
- increase the maximum velocity (p2571).
- check the signal source for the externally limited velocity (CI: p2594).

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: EPOS: Combination of input signals illegal
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Application/technological function faulted

Cause.CauseText: An illegal combination of input signals that are simultaneously set was identified.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret decimal):
0: Jog 1 and jog 2 (p2589, p2590).
1: Jog 1 or jog 2 and direct setpoint input/MDI (p2589, p2590, p2647).
2: Jog 1 or jog 2 and start referencing (p2589, p2590, p2595).
3: Jog 1 or jog 2 and activate traversing task (p2589, p2590, p2631).
4: Direct setpoint input/MDI and starting referencing (p2647, p2595).
5: Direct setpoint input/MDI and activate traversing task (p2647, p2631).
6: Start referencing and activate traversing task (p2595, p2631).

Remedy.RemedyText: Check the appropriate input signals and correct.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: EPOS: Reference cam not found
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Application/technological function faulted

Cause.CauseText: After starting the search for reference, the axis moved through the maximum permissible distance to search for the reference cam without actually finding the reference cam.

Remedy.RemedyText: - check the "reference cam" binector input (BI: p2612).
- check the maximum permissible distance to the reference cam (p2606).
- if axis does not have any reference cam, then set p2607 to 0.

RemedyParameterList.Text: p2606 (EPOS search for reference reference cam maximum distance), p2607 (EPOS search for reference reference cam present), p2612 (EPOS search for reference reference cam)

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: EPOS: No zero mark
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Application/technological function faulted

Cause.CauseText: After leaving the reference cam, the axis has traversed the maximum permissible distance between the reference cam and zero mark without finding the zero mark.

Remedy.RemedyText: - check the encoder regarding the zero mark
- check the maximum permissible distance between the reference cam and zero mark (p2609).
- use an external encoder zero mark (equivalent zero mark) (p0495).

RemedyParameterList.Text: p0495 (Equivalent zero mark input terminal), p2609 (EPOS search for reference max distance ref cam and zero mark)

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: EPOS: End of reference cam not found
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Application/technological function faulted

Cause.CauseText: During the search for reference, when the axis reached the zero mark it also reached the end of the traversing range without detecting an edge at the binector input "reference cam" (BI: p2612).
Maximum traversing range: -2147483648 [LU] ... -2147483647 [LU]

Remedy.RemedyText: - check the "reference cam" binector input (BI: p2612).
- repeat the search for reference.

RemedyParameterList.Text: p2612 (EPOS search for reference reference cam)

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: EPOS: Reference point not set
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Application/technological function faulted

Cause.CauseText: When starting a traversing block/direct setpoint input, a reference point is not set (r2684.11 = 0).

Remedy.RemedyText: Reference the system (search for reference, flying referencing, set reference point).

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: EPOS: Selected traversing block number does not exist
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: A traversing block selected via binector input p2625 ... p2630 was started via binector input p2631 = 0/1 edge "Activate traversing task".
- the number of the started traversing block is not contained in p2616[0...n].
- the started traversing block is suppressed.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret decimal):
Number of the selected traversing block that is also not available.

Remedy.RemedyText: - correct the traversing program.
- select an available traversing block number.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: EPOS: External block change not requested in the traversing block
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Application/technological function faulted

Cause.CauseText: For a traversing block with the block change enable CONTINUE_EXTERNAL_ALARM, the external block change was not requested.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret decimal):
Number of the traversing block.

Remedy.RemedyText: Resolve the reason as to why the edge is missing at binector input (BI: p2632).

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: EPOS: Traversing block is inconsistent
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: The traversing block does not contain valid information.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret decimal):
Number of the traversing block with invalid information.

Remedy.RemedyText: Check the traversing block and where relevant, take into consideration alarms that are present.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: EPOS: Traversing block does not have a subsequent block
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: There is no subsequent block in the traversing block.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret decimal):
Number of the traversing block with the missing subsequent block.

Remedy.RemedyText: - parameterize this traversing block with the block change enable END.
- parameterize additional traversing blocks with a higher block number and for the last block, using the block change enable END.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: EPOS: Traversing block number assigned a multiple number of times
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: The same traversing block number was assigned a multiple number of times.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret decimal):
Number of the traversing block that was assigned a multiple number of times.

Remedy.RemedyText: Correct the traversing blocks.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: EPOS: Traversing block has illegal task parameters
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: The task parameter in the traversing block contains an illegal value.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret decimal):
Number of the traversing block with an illegal task parameter.

Remedy.RemedyText: Correct the task parameter in the traversing block.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: EPOS: Traversing block jump destination does not exist
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: In a traversing block, a jump was programmed to a non-existent block.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret decimal):
Number of the traversing block with a jump destination that does not exist.

Remedy.RemedyText: - correct the traversing block.
- add the missing traversing block.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: EPOS: Traversing block < target position < software limit switch minus
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: In the traversing block the specified absolute target position lies outside the range limited by the software limit switch minus.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret decimal):
Number of the traversing block with illegal target position.

Remedy.RemedyText: - correct the traversing block.
- change software limit switch minus (CI: p2578, p2580).

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: EPOS: Traversing block> target position > software limit switch plus
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: In the traversing block the specified absolute target position lies outside the range limited by the software limit switch plus.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret decimal):
Number of the traversing block with illegal target position.

Remedy.RemedyText: - correct the traversing block.
- change software limit switch plus (CI: p2579, p2581).

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: EPOS: Traversing block target position outside the modulo range
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Application/technological function faulted

Cause.CauseText: In the traversing block the target position lies outside the modulo range.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret decimal):
Number of the traversing block with illegal target position.

Remedy.RemedyText: - in the traversing block, correct the target position.
- change the modulo range (p2576).

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: EPOS: Traversing block ABS_POS/ABS_NEG not possible
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Application/technological function faulted

Cause.CauseText: In the traversing block the positioning mode ABS_POS or ABS_NEG were parameterized with the modulo correction not activated.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret decimal):
Number of the traversing block with the illegal positioning mode.

Remedy.RemedyText: Correct the traversing block.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: EPOS: Beginning of traversing range reached
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Application/technological function faulted

Cause.CauseText: When traversing, the axis has moved to the traversing range limit.

Remedy.RemedyText: Move away in the positive direction.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: EPOS: End of traversing range reached
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Application/technological function faulted

Cause.CauseText: When traversing, the axis has moved to the traversing range limit.

Remedy.RemedyText: Move away in the negative direction.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: EPOS: Target position < start of traversing range
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: The target position for relative traversing lies outside the traversing range.

Remedy.RemedyText: Correct the target position.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: EPOS: Target position > end of the traversing range
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: The target position for relative traversing lies outside the traversing range.

Remedy.RemedyText: Correct the target position.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: EPOS: Target position < software limit switch minus
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: In the actual traversing operation, the target position is less than the software limit switch minus.

Remedy.RemedyText: - correct the target position.
- change software limit switch minus (CI: p2578, p2580).

RemedyParameterList.Text: p2578 (EPOS software limit switch minus signal source), p2580 (EPOS software limit switch minus), p2582 (EPOS software limit switch activation)

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: EPOS: Target position > software limit switch plus
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: In the actual traversing operation, the target position is greater than the software limit switch plus.

Remedy.RemedyText: - correct the target position.
- change software limit switch plus (CI: p2579, p2581).

RemedyParameterList.Text: p2579 (EPOS software limit switch plus signal source), p2581 (EPOS software limit switch plus), p2582 (EPOS software limit switch activation)

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: EPOS: Software limit switch minus reached
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Application/technological function faulted

Cause.CauseText: The axis is at the position of the software limit switch minus. An active traversing block was interrupted.

Remedy.RemedyText: - correct the target position.
- change software limit switch minus (CI: p2578, p2580).

RemedyParameterList.Text: p2578 (EPOS software limit switch minus signal source), p2580 (EPOS software limit switch minus), p2582 (EPOS software limit switch activation)

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: EPOS: Software limit switch plus reached
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Application/technological function faulted

Cause.CauseText: The axis is at the position of the software limit switch plus. An active traversing block was interrupted.

Remedy.RemedyText: - correct the target position.
- change software limit switch plus (CI: p2579, p2581).

RemedyParameterList.Text: p2579 (EPOS software limit switch plus signal source), p2581 (EPOS software limit switch plus), p2582 (EPOS software limit switch activation)

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: EPOS: Axis position < software limit switch minus
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Application/technological function faulted

Cause.CauseText: The actual position of the axis is less than the position of the software limit switch minus.

Remedy.RemedyText: - correct the target position.
- change software limit switch minus (CI: p2578, p2580).

RemedyParameterList.Text: p2578 (EPOS software limit switch minus signal source), p2580 (EPOS software limit switch minus), p2582 (EPOS software limit switch activation)

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: EPOS: Axis position > software limit switch plus
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Application/technological function faulted

Cause.CauseText: The actual position of the axis is greater than the position of the software limit switch plus.

Remedy.RemedyText: - correct the target position.
- change software limit switch plus (CI: p2579, p2581).

RemedyParameterList.Text: p2579 (EPOS software limit switch plus signal source), p2581 (EPOS software limit switch plus), p2582 (EPOS software limit switch activation)

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: EPOS: Travel to fixed stop clamping torque not reached
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Application/technological function faulted

Cause.CauseText: The fixed stop in the traversing block was reached without the clamping torque/clamping force having been achieved.

Remedy.RemedyText: - check the maximum torque-generating current (r1533).
- check the torque limits (p1520, p1521).
- check the power limits (p1530, p1531).
- check the BICO interconnections of the torque limits (p1522, p1523, p1528, p1529).

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: EPOS: Fixed stop outside the monitoring window
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Application/technological function faulted

Cause.CauseText: In the "fixed stop reached" state, the axis has moved outside the defined monitoring window (p2635).

Remedy.RemedyText: - check the monitoring window (p2635).
- check the mechanical system.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: EPOS: Fixed stop not reached
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Application/technological function faulted

Cause.CauseText: In a traversing block with the task FIXED STOP, the end position was reached without detecting a fixed stop.

Remedy.RemedyText: - check the traversing block and locate the target position further into the workpiece.
- check the "fixed stop reached" control signal (p2637).
- if required, reduce the maximum following error window to detect the fixed stop (p2634).

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: EPOS: Intermediate stop missing
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Application/technological function faulted

Cause.CauseText: In the modes "traversing blocks" or "direct setpoint input/MDI" at the start of motion, the binector input "no intermediate stop/intermediate stop" (BI: p2640) did not have a 1 signal.

Remedy.RemedyText: Connect a 1 signal to the binector input "no intermediate stop/intermediate stop" (BI: p2640) and re-start motion.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: EPOS: Reject traversing task missing
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Application/technological function faulted

Cause.CauseText: In the modes "traversing blocks" or "direct setpoint input/MDI" at the start of motion, the binector input "do not reject traversing task/reject traversing task" (BI: p2641) does not have a 1 signal.

Remedy.RemedyText: Connect a 1 signal to the binector input "do not reject traversing task/reject traversing task" (BI: p2641) and restart motion.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: EPOS: Relative positioning not possible
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Application/technological function faulted

Cause.CauseText: In the mode "direct setpoint input/MDI", for continuous transfer (p2649 = 1) relative positioning was selected (BI: p2648 = 0 signal).

Remedy.RemedyText: Check the control.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: EPOS: Reference point correction outside the window
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Application/technological function faulted

Cause.CauseText: For the function "flying referencing" the difference between the measured position at the measuring probe and the reference point coordinate lies outside the parameterized window.

Remedy.RemedyText: - check the mechanical system.
- check the parameterization of the window (p2602).

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: EPOS: Enable signal withdrawn while traversing
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Application/technological function faulted

Cause.CauseText: - for a standard assignment, another fault may have occurred as a result of withdrawing the enable signals.
- the drive is in the "switching on inhibited" state (for a standard assignment).

Remedy.RemedyText: - set the enable signals or check the cause of the fault that first occurred and then result (for a standard assignment).
- check the assignment to enable the basic positioning function.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: EPOS: STOP cam minus reached
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Application/technological function faulted

Cause.CauseText: A 0 signal was detected at binector input p2569, i.e. the STOP cam minus was actuated.
For a positive traversing direction, the STOP cam minus was reached - i.e. the wiring of the STOP cam is incorrect.

Remedy.RemedyText: - leave the STOP cam minus in the positive traversing direction and return the axis to the valid traversing range.
- check the wiring of the STOP cam.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: EPOS: STOP cam plus reached
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Application/technological function faulted

Cause.CauseText: A 0 signal was detected at binector input p2570, i.e. the STOP cam plus was reached.
For a negative traversing direction, the STOP cam plus was reached - i.e. the wiring of the STOP cam is incorrect.

Remedy.RemedyText: - leave the STOP cam plus in the negative traversing direction and return the axis to the valid traversing range.
- check the wiring of the STOP cam.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: LR: Overflow of the value range for position actual value
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Application/technological function faulted

Cause.CauseText: The value range (-2147483648 ... 2147483647) for the position actual value representation was exceeded.
When the overflow occurs, the "referenced" or "adjustment absolute measuring system" status is reset.
Fault value (r0949, interpret decimal):
1: The position actual value (r2521) has exceeded the value range.
2: The encoder position actual value Gn_XIST2 (r0483) or the absolute value after the load gear (r2723) has exceeded the value range.

3: The maximum encoder value times the factor to convert the absolute position (r0483 and/or r2723) from increments to length units (LU) has exceeded the value range for displaying the position actual value.
Note:
For a linear encoder, the following must be maintained:

Remedy.RemedyText: If required, reduce the traversing range or position resolution (p2506).
Increase the fine resolution of absolute position actual value (p0419).
Note for fault value = 3:
If the value for the maximum possible absolute position (LU) is greater than 4294967296, then it is not possible to make an adjustment due to an overflow.
For rotary encoders, the maximum possible absolute position (LU) is calculated as follows:
1. Motor encoder without position tracking
p2506 * p0433 * p2505 * p0421 / (p0432 * p2504) for multiturn encoders
2. Motor encoder with position tracking for measuring gear
3. Motor encoder with position tracking for load gear
4. Motor encoder with position tracking for load and measuring gear
5. Direct encoder without position tracking
p2506 * p0433 * p0421 / p0432 for multiturn encoders
6. Direct encoder with position tracking for measuring gear

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: LR: Drive Data Set changeover in operation
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Application/technological function faulted

Cause.CauseText: A Drive Data Set changeover (DDS) with a change of the mechanical relationships (p2503 ... 2506), direction of rotation (p1821) or the encoder assignment (p2502) was requested in operation.
Note:
DDS: Drive Data Set

Remedy.RemedyText: To changeover the drive data set, initially, exit the "operation" mode.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: LR: Reference function interrupted
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Application/technological function faulted

Cause.CauseText: An activated reference function (reference mark search or measuring probe evaluation) was interrupted.
Possible causes:
- an encoder fault has occurred (Gn_ZSW.15 = 1).
- position actual value was set during an activated reference function.
- simultaneously activate reference mark search and measuring probe evaluation (BI: p2508 and BI: p2509 = 1 signal).
- activated reference function (reference mark search or measuring probe evaluation) was deactivated (BI: p2508 and BI: p2509 = 0 signal).
- the input terminal for the measuring probe is not set.

Remedy.RemedyText: - check the causes and resolve.
- reset the control (BI: p2508 and BI: p2509 = 0 signal) and activate the requested function.
- set the input terminal for the measuring probe (p0488, p0489 or p2517, p2518).

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: EPOS: Enable not possible
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Application/technological function faulted

Cause.CauseText: It is not possible to enable the basic positioner because at least one condition is missing.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret decimal):
1: EPOS enable missing (BI: p2656).
2: Position actual value, valid feedback signal missing (BI: p2658).

CauseParameterList.Text: p2656 (EPOS enable basic positioner), p2658 (EPOS position actual value valid feedback signal)

Remedy.RemedyText: Check the corresponding missing condition (binector input, signal source).

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: LR: Position setting value activated
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Application/technological function faulted

Cause.CauseText: While the binector input p2514 has a 1 signal, the position actual value is set to the value received via connector input p2515. A possible system deviation cannot be corrected.

Remedy.RemedyText: Not necessary.
The alarm is automatically withdrawn for binector input p2514 = 0 signal.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: LR: Measuring probe evaluation not possible
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Application/technological function faulted

Cause.CauseText: When evaluating the measuring probe, an error occurred.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret decimal):
The input terminal for the measuring probe is not set.
Error when initializing the measuring probe.
The measuring pulse frequency is too high.
The measuring clock cycle is not a multiple integer of the position controller clock cycle.

Remedy.RemedyText: Deactivate the measuring probe evaluation (BI: p2509 = 0 signal).
For alarm value = 6:
Set the input terminal for the measuring probe (p0488, p0489 or p2517, p2518).
For alarm value = 4098:
Check the Control Unit hardware.
For alarm value = 4100:
Reduce the frequency of the measuring pulses at the measuring probe.
For alarm value > 50000:
Set the clock cycle ratio of the measuring clock cycle to the position controller clock cycle to an integer multiple.
To do this, the currently effective measuring clock cycle can be determined from the alarm value as follows:
Tmeas [125 s] = alarm value - 50000
With PROFIBUS, the measuring clock cycle corresponds to the PROFIBUS clock cycle (r2064[1]).
Without PROFIBUS, the measuring clock cycle is an internal cycle time that cannot be influenced.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: EPOS: Reversing cam approached with the incorrect traversing direction
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Application/technological function faulted

Cause.CauseText: The reversing cam MINUS was approached in the positive traversing direction or the reversing cam PLUS was approached in the negative traversing direction.

CauseParameterList.Text: p2613 (EPOS search for reference reversing cam minus), p2614 (EPOS search for reference reversing cam plus)

Remedy.RemedyText: - check the wiring of the reversing cam (BI: p2613, BI: p2614).
- check the traversing direction to approach the reversing cam.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Drive: Power unit data set PDS not configured
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: Only for controlled line supply infeed/regenerative feedback units:
The power unit data set was not configured - this means that a data set number was not entered into the drive data set.
Fault value (r0949, interpret decimal):
Drive data set number of p0185.

Remedy.RemedyText: The index of the power unit data set associated with the drive data set should be entered into p0185.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Drive: Motor Data Set MDS not configured
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: Only for power units:
The motor data set was not configured - this means that a data set number was not entered into the associated drive data set.
Fault value (r0949, interpret decimal):
The fault value includes the drive data set number of p0186.

Remedy.RemedyText: The index of the motor data set associated with the drive data set should be entered into p0186.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Drive: Encoder Data Set EDS not configured
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: Only for power units:
The encoder data set was not configured - this means that a data set number was not entered into the associated drive data set.
Fault value (r0949, interpret decimal):
The fault value includes the drive data set number of p0187, p0188 and p0189.
The fault value is increased by 100 * encoder number (e.g. for p0189: Fault value 3xx with xx = data set number).

Remedy.RemedyText: The index of the encoder data set associated with the drive data set should be entered into p0187 (1st encoder), p0188 (2nd encoder) and p0189 (3rd encoder).

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: EPOS: STOP cam approached with the incorrect traversing direction
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Application/technological function faulted

Cause.CauseText: The STOP cam MINUS was approached in the positive traversing direction or the STOP cam PLUS was approached in the negative traversing direction.

Remedy.RemedyText: - check the wiring of the STOP cam (BI: p2569, BI: p2570).
- check the traversing direction to approach the STOP cam.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, ENC, HLA, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Drive: Motor data set is not assigned to a drive data set
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: A motor data set is not assigned to a drive object.
All of the existing motor data sets in the drive data sets must be assigned using the MDS number (p0186[0...n]). There must be at least as many drive data sets as motor data sets.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret decimal):
Number of the motor data set that has not been assigned.

Remedy.RemedyText: In the drive data sets, assign the non-assigned motor data set using the MDS number (p0186[0...n]).
- check whether all of the motor data sets are assigned to drive data sets.
- if required, delete superfluous motor data sets.
- if required, set up new drive data sets and assign to the corresponding motor data sets.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: EPOS: Task fixed stop not possible in the U/f/SLVC mode
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: In the U/f/SLVC mode, an attempt was made to execute a traversing block with the "fixed stop" task. This is not possible.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret decimal):
Number of the traversing block with an illegal task parameter.

Remedy.RemedyText: - check the traversing block and change the task.
- change the open-loop/closed-loop control mode (p1300).

RemedyParameterList.Text: p1300 (Open-loop/closed-loop control operating mode), p2621 (EPOS traversing block task)

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: EPOS: check BICO interconnection between EPOS and position controller
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Application/technological function faulted

Cause.CauseText: The BICO interconnections to transfer setpoints between EPOS and LR (position control) have not been set, although the BICO interconnections to transfer the fine resolutions have been set.

Remedy.RemedyText: 1. Disconnect BICO interconnections for the fine resolutions (CI: p2694 = 0, CI: p2695 = 0).
2. Set BICO interconnections for the setpoints (CI: p2530 = r2665, CI: p2531 = r2666).
3. Set BICO interconnections for the fine resolutions (CI: p2694 = r2696, CI: p2695 = r2697).

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: EPOS: reference point cannot be set
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Application/technological function faulted

Cause.CauseText: After the reference point correction, the position setpoint lies outside the traversing range limits.

Remedy.RemedyText: - optimize the position controller.
- due to a possible position controller deviation, reference point coordinate p2599 should not be directly placed at the traversing range limits.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, ENC, HLA, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Drive: Component assignment missing
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: A Drive Data Set (DDS) is assigned to a Motor Data Set (MDS) or Encoder Data Set (EDS) that does not have a component number.
Fault value (r0949, interpret decimal):
nnmmmxxyyy
nn: Number of the MDS/EDS.
mmm: Parameter number of the missing component number.
xx: Number of the DDS that is assigned to the MDS/EDS.
yyy: Parameter number that references the MDS/EDS.
Example:
p0186[7] = 5: DDS 7 is assigned MDS 5.
p0131[5] = 0: There is no component number set in MDS 5.
Alarm value = 0513107186

Remedy.RemedyText: In the drive data sets, no longer assign MDS/EDS using p0186, p0187, p0188, p0189 or set a valid component number.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Drive: Identical encoder in the drive data set
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: More than one encoder with identical component number is assigned to a single drive data set. In one drive data set, it is not permissible that identical encoders are operated together.
Fault value (r0949, interpret decimal):
1000 * first identical encoder + 100 * second identical encoder + drive data set.
Example:
Fault value = 1203 means:
In drive data set 3, the first (p0187[3]) and second encoder (p0188[3]) are identical.

Remedy.RemedyText: Assign the drive data set to different encoders.

RemedyParameterList.Text: p0141, p0187 (Encoder 1 encoder data set number), p0188 (Encoder 2 encoder data set number), p0189 (Encoder 3 encoder data set number)

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Drive: Encoder used a multiple number of times
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: Each encoder may only be assigned to one drive and within a drive must - in each drive data set - either always be encoder 1, always encoder 2 or always encoder 3. This unique assignment has been violated.
Fault value (r0949, interpret decimal):
The two parameters in coded form, that refer to the same component number.
First parameter:
Index: First and second decimal place (99 for EDS, not assigned DDS)
Parameter number: Third decimal place (1 for p0187, 2 for p0188, 3 for p0189, 4 for EDS not assigned DDS)
Drive number: Fourth and fifth decimal place
Second parameter:
Index: Sixth and seventh decimal place (99 for EDS, not assigned DDS)
Parameter number: Eighth decimal place (1 for p0187, 2 for p0188, 3 for p0189, 4 for EDS, not assigned DDS)
Drive number: Ninth and tenth decimal place

Remedy.RemedyText: Correct the double use of a component number using the two parameters coded in the fault value.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, ENC, HLA, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Drive: Encoder data set changeover cannot be parameterized
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: Using p0141, a changeover of the encoder data set is prepared that is illegal. In this firmware release, an encoder data set changeover is only permitted for the components in the actual topology.
Fault value (r0949, interpret decimal):
Incorrect EDS data set number.

CauseParameterList.Text: p0187 (Encoder 1 encoder data set number), p0188 (Encoder 2 encoder data set number), p0189 (Encoder 3 encoder data set number)

Remedy.RemedyText: Every encoder data set must be assigned its own dedicated DRIVE-CLiQ socket. The component numbers of the encoder interfaces (p0141) must have different values within a drive object.
The following must apply:
p0141[0] not equal to p0141[1] not equal to ... not equal to p0141[n]

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, ENC, HLA, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Drive: Data structure does not correspond to the interface module
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: The interface mode "SIMODRIVE 611 universal" was set (p2038 = 1) and the data structure does not correspond to this mode.
The following settings are possible, depending on the number of data sets:
Number of DDS/MDS (p0180/p0130): p0186

CauseParameterList.Text: p0180 (Number of Drive Data Sets (DDS)), p0186 (Motor Data Sets (MDS) number), p2038 (IF1 PROFIdrive STW/ZSW interface mode)

Remedy.RemedyText: - check the data structure according to the possible settings mentioned in the cause.
- check the interface mode (p2038).

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, ENC, HLA, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Drive: Power unit and motor incorrectly connected
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: A power unit (via PDS) was assigned to a motor (via MDS) in a drive data set that is not connected in the target topology. It is possible that a motor has not been assigned to the power unit (p0131).
Fault value (r0949, interpret decimal):
Number of the incorrectly parameterized drive data set.

Remedy.RemedyText: - assign the drive data set to a combination of motor and power unit permitted by the target topology.
- adapt the target topology.
- if required, for a missing motor, recreate the component (drive Wizard).

RemedyParameterList.Text: p0121 (Power unit component number), p0131 (Motor component number), p0186 (Motor Data Sets (MDS) number)

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, ENC, HLA, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Drive: Re-commission the data set
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: The assignment between the drive data set and motor data set (p0186) or between the drive data set and the encoder data set was modified (p0187). This is the reason that the drive data set must re-commissioned.
Fault value (r0949, interpret decimal):
Drive data set to be re-commissioned.

Remedy.RemedyText: Commission the drive data set specified in the fault value (r0949).

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, ENC, HLA, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Drive: Encoder data set changeover incorrectly parameterized
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: In at least two drive data sets (DDS), the same motor data set (MDS) is assigned different encoder data sets (EDS) for the motor encoder. In various DDSs, it is not permissible for an MDS to have different motor encoders.
The following parameterization therefore results results in an error:
Fault value (r0949, interpret decimal):
The lower 16 bits indicate the first DDS. The upper 16 bits indicate the second DDS.

Remedy.RemedyText: Create two MDS with the same motor data in order to operate one motor with different motor encoders.
Example:

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, ENC, HLA, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Drive: Motor data set changeover incorrectly parameterized
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: The system has identified that two motor data sets were incorrectly parameterized.

Parameter r0313 (calculated from p0314, p0310, p0311), r0315 and p1982 may only have different values if the motor data sets are assigned different motors. p0827 is used to assign the motors and/contactors.
It is not possible to toggle between motor data sets.
Fault value (r0949, interpret hexadecimal):
xxxxyyyy:
xxxx: First DDS with assigned MDS, yyyy: Second DDS with assigned MDS

Remedy.RemedyText: Correct the parameterization of the motor data sets.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: HLA, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Drive: Motor changeover incorrectly parameterized
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: With the setting p0833.0 = 1, a motor changeover via the application is selected. This is the reason that p0827 must have different values in the appropriate motor data set.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret hexadecimal):
xxxxyyyy:
xxxx: First MDS, yyyy: Second MDS

Remedy.RemedyText: - parameterize the appropriate motor data sets differently (p0827).
- select the setting p0833.0 = 0 (motor changeover via the drive).

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: HLA, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Drive: Motor cannot be changed over
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Application/technological function faulted

Cause.CauseText: The motor cannot be changed over.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret decimal):

The contactor for the motor that is presently active cannot be opened, because for a synchronous motor, the speed (r0063) is greater than the speed at the start of field weakening (p0348). As long as r0063 > p0348, the current in the motor does not decay in spite of the pulses being suppressed.
The "contactor opened" feedback signal was not detected within 1 s.
The "contactor closed" feedback signal was not detected within 1 s.

Remedy.RemedyText: For alarm value = 1:
Set the speed lower than the speed at the start of field weakening (r0063 < p0348).
For alarm value = 2, 3:
Check the feedback signals of the contactor involved.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, ENC, HLA, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Drive: Drive Data Set DDS not present
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: The selected drive data set is not available (p0837 > p0180). The drive data set was not changed over.

Remedy.RemedyText: - select the existing drive data set.
- set up additional drive data sets.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Drive: Command Data Set CDS not present
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: The selected command data set is not available (p0836 > p0170). The command data set was not changed over.

Remedy.RemedyText: - select the existing command data set.
- set up additional command data sets.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, ENC, HLA, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Drive: Data set changeover not possible
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Application/technological function faulted

Cause.CauseText: The selected drive data set changeover and the assigned motor changeover are not possible and are not carried out.
For synchronous motors, the motor contactor may only be switched for actual speeds less than the speed at the start of field weakening (r0063 < p0348).

Remedy.RemedyText: Reduce the speed to below the speed at the start of field weakening (r0063 < p0348).

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, ENC, HLA, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Drive: Not possible to reset encoder parameters
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Hardware/software error

Cause.CauseText: When carrying out a factory setting (e.g. using p0970 = 1), it was not possible to reset the encoder parameters. The encoder parameters are directly read out of the encoder via DRIVE-CLiQ.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret decimal):
Component number of the encoder involved.

Remedy.RemedyText: - repeat the operation.
- check the DRIVE-CLiQ connection.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: HLA, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Drive encoder: No commutation angle information
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: The commutation angle information is missing. This means that synchronous motors cannot be controlled (closed-loop control)
Fault value (r0949, interpret decimal):
yyyyxxxx dec: yyyy = fault cause, xxxx = drive data set
yyyy = 1 dec:
The motor encoder used does not supply an absolute commutation angle.
yyyy = 2 dec:
The selected ratio of the measuring gear does not match the motor pole pair number.

Remedy.RemedyText: For fault cause = 1:
- check the encoder parameterization (p0404).
- use an encoder with track C/D, EnDat interface of Hall sensors.

- use an encoder with sinusoidal A/B track for which the motor pole pair number (r0313) multiplied by the gear ratio (p0432/p0433) is less than the encoder pulse number (p0408) or is an integer multiple of the encoder pulse number (p0408).
- activate the pole position identification routine (p1982 = 1).
For fault cause = 2:
- the quotient of the pole pair number divided by the ratio of the measuring gear must be an integer number: (p0314 * p0433) / p0432.
Note:
For operation with track C/D, this quotient must be less than 8.

RemedyParameterList.Text: p0402 (Gearbox type selection), p0404 (Encoder configuration effective), p0432 (Gearbox factor encoder revolutions), p0433 (Gearbox factor motor/load revolutions)

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Drive encoder: No commutation angle information
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: The commutation angle information is missing. This means that synchronous motors cannot be controlled (closed-loop control)
Fault value (r0949, interpret decimal):
yyyyxxxx dec: yyyy = fault cause, xxxx = drive data set
yyyy = 1 dec:
The motor encoder used does not supply an absolute commutation angle.
yyyy = 2 dec:
The selected ratio of the measuring gear does not match the motor pole pair number.

Remedy.RemedyText: For fault cause = 1:
- check the encoder parameterization (p0404).
- use an encoder with track C/D, EnDat interface of Hall sensors.

- use an encoder with sinusoidal A/B track for which the motor pole pair number (r0313) multiplied by the gear ratio (p0432/p0433) is less than the encoder pulse number (p0408) or is an integer multiple of the encoder pulse number (p0408).

- activate the pole position identification routine (p1982 = 1) for motor encoders without absolute position information. Then, using an encoder adjustment (p1990), the angular commutation offset should be determined.
For fault cause = 2:
- the quotient of the pole pair number divided by the ratio of the measuring gear must be an integer number: (p0314 * p0433) / p0432.
Note:
For operation with track C/D, this quotient must be less than 8.

RemedyParameterList.Text: p0402 (Gearbox type selection), p0404 (Encoder configuration effective), p0432 (Gearbox factor encoder revolutions), p0433 (Gearbox factor motor/load revolutions)

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, ENC, HLA, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Drive encoder: Encoder configuration not supported
SINAMICSAlarm.AddInfo: Fault cause: %1, component number: %2, encoder data set: %3
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: The requested encoder configuration is not supported. Only bits may be requested in p0404 that are signaled as being supported by the encoder evaluation in r0456.
Fault value (r0949, interpret decimal):
ccccbbaa hex: cccc = fault cause, bb = component number, aa = encoder data set
cccc = 1: encoder sin/cos with absolute track (is supported by SME25).
cccc = 3: Squarewave encoder (this is supported by SMC30).
cccc = 4: sin/cos encoder (this is supported by SMC20, SMI20, SME20, SME25).
cccc = 10: DRIVE-CLiQ encoder (is supported by DQI).
cccc = 12: sin/cos encoder with reference mark (this is supported by SME20).
cccc = 15: Commutation with zero mark for separately excited synchronous motors with VECTORMV.
cccc = 23: Resolver (this is supported by SMC10, SMI10).
cccc = 65535: Other function (compare r0456 and p0404).

CauseParameterList.Text: p0404 (Encoder configuration effective), r0456 (Encoder configuration supported)

Remedy.RemedyText: - check the encoder parameterization (p0400, p0404).
- use the matching encoder evaluation (r0456).

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, ENC, HLA, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Drive encoder: Sensor Module configuration not supported
SINAMICSAlarm.AddInfo: Encoder data set: %1, first incorrect bit: %2, incorrect parameter: %3
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: The Sensor Module does not support the requested configuration.
For incorrect p0430 (cc = 0), the following applies:
- in p0430 (requested functions), at least 1 bit was set that is not set in r0458 (supported functions) (exception: Bit 19, 28, 29, 30, 31).
- p1982 > 0 (pole position identification requested), but r0458.16 = 0 (pole position identification not supported).
For incorrect p0437 (cc = 1), the following applies:
- in p0437 (requested functions), at least 1 bit was set that is not set in r0459 (supported functions).
Fault value (r0949, interpret hexadecimal):
ddccbbaa hex
aa: encoder data set number
bb: first incorrect bit
cc: incorrect parameter
cc = 0: incorrect parameter is p0430
cc = 1: incorrect parameter is p0437
cc = 2: incorrect parameter is r0459
dd: reserved (always 0)

Remedy.RemedyText: - check the encoder parameterization (p0430, p0437).
- check the pole position identification routine (p1982).
- use the matching encoder evaluation (r0458, r0459).

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, ENC, HLA, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Drive encoder: Configuration position tracking
SINAMICSAlarm.AddInfo: Component number: %1, encoder data set: %2, drive data set: %3, fault cause: %4
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Error in the parameterization / configuration / commissioning procedure

Cause.CauseText: For position tracking, the configuration is not supported.
Position tracking can only be activated for absolute encoders.
For linear axes, it is not possible to simultaneously activate the position tracking for load and measuring gears.
Fault value (r0949, interpret hexadecimal):
ddccbbaa hex
aa = encoder data set
bb = component number
cc = drive data set
dd = fault cause
dd = 00 hex = 0 dec
An absolute encoder is not being used.
dd = 01 hex = 1 dec
Position tracking cannot be activated because the memory of the internal NVRAM is not sufficient or a Control Unit does not have an NVRAM.
dd = 02 hex = 2 dec
For a linear axis, the position tracking was activated for the load and measuring gear.
dd = 03 hex = 3 dec
Position tracking cannot be activated because position tracking with another gear ratio, axis type or tolerance window has already been detected for this encoder data set.
dd = 04 hex = 4 dec
A linear encoder is being used.

CauseParameterList.Text: p0404 (Encoder configuration effective), p0411 (Measuring gear configuration)

Remedy.RemedyText: For fault value 0:
- use an absolute encoder.
For fault value 1:
- use a Control Unit with sufficient NVRAM.
For fault value = 2, 4:
- if necessary, deselect the position tracking (p0411 for the measuring gear, p2720 for the load gear).
For fault value 3:

- Only activate position tracking of the load gear in the same encoder data set if the gear ratio (p2504, p2505), axis type (p2720.1) and tolerance window (p2722) are also the same. These parameters must be the same in all drive data sets, which use the same motor encoder (p187).

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, ENC, HLA, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Measuring gear: Position tracking, maximum actual value exceeded
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Actual position/speed value incorrect or not available

Cause.CauseText: When the position tracking of the measuring gear is configured, the drive/encoder identifies a maximum possible absolute position actual value (r0483) that cannot be represented within 32 bits.
Maximum value: p0408 * p0412 * 2^p0419
Fault value (r0949, interpret decimal):
aaaayyxx hex: yy = component number, xx = encoder data set

CauseParameterList.Text: p0408, p0412 (Measuring gear absolute encoder rotary revolutions virtual), p0419 (Fine resolution absolute value Gx_XIST2 (in bits))

Remedy.RemedyText: - reduce the fine resolution (p0419).
- reduce the multiturn resolution (p0412).

RemedyParameterList.Text: p0412 (Measuring gear absolute encoder rotary revolutions virtual), p0419 (Fine resolution absolute value Gx_XIST2 (in bits))

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Encoder 1: Reference point coordinate not in the permissible range
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Application/technological function faulted

Cause.CauseText: The reference point coordinate received when adjusting the encoder via connector input CI:p2599 lies outside the half of the encoder range and cannot be set as actual axis position. The maximum permissible value is displayed in the supplementary information.

Remedy.RemedyText: Set the reference point coordinate less than the value from the supplementary information.

RemedyParameterList.Text: p2598 (EPOS reference point coordinate signal source)

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Encoder 2: Reference point coordinate not in the permissible range
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Application/technological function faulted

Cause.CauseText: The reference point coordinate received when adjusting the encoder via connector input CI:p2599 lies outside the half of the encoder range and cannot be set as actual axis position. The maximum permissible value is displayed in the supplementary information.
