SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, HLA, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM41, TM54F_MA, TM54F_SL, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: TM DRIVE-CLiQ: Sign-of-life missing
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Internal (DRIVE-CLiQ) communication error

Cause.CauseText: A DRIVE-CLiQ communication error has occurred between the Control Unit and the Terminal Module involved.
Fault cause:
The sign-of-life bit in the receive telegram is not set.
Note regarding the message value:
The individual information is coded as follows in the message value (r0949/r2124):
0000yyxx hex: yy = component number, xx = error cause

Remedy.RemedyText: - check the DRIVE-CLiQ connection.
- replace the component involved.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, HLA, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM41, TM54F_MA, TM54F_SL, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: TM: Time slice overflow
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Hardware/software error

Cause.CauseText: A time slice overflow has occurred on the Terminal Module.

Remedy.RemedyText: Replace the Terminal Module.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, HLA, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM15, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: TM: Memory test
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Hardware/software error

Cause.CauseText: An error has occurred during the memory test on the Terminal Module.

Remedy.RemedyText: - check whether the permissible ambient temperature for the Terminal Module is being maintained.
- replace the Terminal Module.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, HLA, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM41, TM54F_MA, TM54F_SL, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: TM: CRC
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Hardware/software error

Cause.CauseText: A checksum error has occurred when reading-out the program memory on the Terminal Module.
Fault value (r0949, interpret hexadecimal):
Difference between the checksum at POWER ON and the actual checksum.

Remedy.RemedyText: - check whether the permissible ambient temperature for the component is maintained.
- replace the Terminal Module.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, HLA, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM41, TM54F_MA, TM54F_SL, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: TM: EEPROM checksum error
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Hardware/software error

Cause.CauseText: Internal parameter data is corrupted.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret hexadecimal):
01: EEPROM access error.
02: Too many blocks in the EEPROM.

Remedy.RemedyText: - check whether the permissible ambient temperature for the component is maintained.
- replace the Terminal Module 31 (TM31).

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, HLA, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM15, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: TM: Sequence control time monitoring
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Hardware/software error

Cause.CauseText: Error, timeout, sequence control on the Terminal Module.

Remedy.RemedyText: Replace the Terminal Module.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, HLA, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM41, TM54F_MA, TM54F_SL, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: TM DRIVE-CLiQ: Telegram error
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Internal (DRIVE-CLiQ) communication error

Cause.CauseText: A DRIVE-CLiQ communication error has occurred from the Control Unit to the Terminal Module involved.
Fault cause:
Checksum error (CRC error).
Telegram is shorter than specified in the length byte or in the receive list.
Telegram is longer than specified in the length byte or in the receive list.
The length of the receive telegram does not match the receive list.
The type of the receive telegram does not match the receive list.
The address of the component in the telegram and in the receive list do not match.
A SYNC telegram is expected - but the received telegram is not a SYNC telegram.
No SYNC telegram is expected - but the received telegram is one.
The error bit in the receive telegram is set.
The receive telegram is too early.
Note regarding the message value:
The individual information is coded as follows in the message value (r0949/r2124):
0000yyxx hex: yy = component number, xx = error cause

Remedy.RemedyText: - carry out a POWER ON (switch-off/switch-on).
- check the electrical cabinet design and cable routing for EMC compliance
- check the DRIVE-CLiQ wiring (interrupted cable, contacts, ...).

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, HLA, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM41, TM54F_MA, TM54F_SL, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: TM DRIVE-CLiQ: Cyclic data transfer error
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Internal (DRIVE-CLiQ) communication error

Cause.CauseText: A DRIVE-CLiQ communication error has occurred from the Control Unit to the Terminal Module involved. The nodes do not send and receive in synchronism.
Fault cause:
The cyclic telegram has not been received.
Timeout in the telegram receive list.
Timeout in the telegram send list.
Note regarding the message value:
The individual information is coded as follows in the message value (r0949/r2124):
0000yyxx hex: yy = component number, xx = error cause

Remedy.RemedyText: - carry out a POWER ON.
- replace the component involved.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, HLA, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM41, TM54F_MA, TM54F_SL, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: TM DRIVE-CLiQ: Send error for DRIVE-CLiQ data
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Internal (DRIVE-CLiQ) communication error

Cause.CauseText: A DRIVE-CLiQ communication error has occurred between the Control Unit and the Terminal Module involved. Data were not able to be sent.
Fault cause:
Telegram type does not match send list.
Note regarding the message value:
The individual information is coded as follows in the message value (r0949/r2124):
0000yyxx hex: yy = component number, xx = error cause

Remedy.RemedyText: Carry out a POWER ON.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, HLA, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM41, TM54F_MA, TM54F_SL, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: PTM DRIVE-CLiQ: Component fault
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Internal (DRIVE-CLiQ) communication error

Cause.CauseText: Fault detected on the DRIVE-CLiQ component concerned. Faulty hardware cannot be excluded.
Fault cause:
Error in the telegram header.
Receive error: The telegram buffer memory contains an error.
Send error: The telegram buffer memory contains an error.
Send error: The telegram buffer memory contains an error.
Note regarding the message value:
The individual information is coded as follows in the message value (r0949/r2124):
0000yyxx hex: yy = component number, xx = error cause

Remedy.RemedyText: - check the DRIVE-CLiQ wiring (interrupted cable, contacts, ...).
- check the electrical cabinet design and cable routing for EMC compliance
- if required, use another DRIVE-CLiQ socket (p9904).
- replace the component involved.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, HLA, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM41, TM54F_MA, TM54F_SL, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: TM DRIVE-CLiQ: Cyclic data transfer error
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Internal (DRIVE-CLiQ) communication error

Cause.CauseText: A DRIVE-CLiQ communication error has occurred between the Control Unit and the Terminal Module (TM) involved.
Fault cause:
Synchronization error during alternating cyclic data transfer.
Note regarding the message value:
The individual information is coded as follows in the message value (r0949/r2124):
0000yyxx hex: yy = component number, xx = error cause

Remedy.RemedyText: Carry out a POWER ON.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, HLA, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM41, TM54F_MA, TM54F_SL, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: TM: Internal software error
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Hardware/software error

Cause.CauseText: An internal software error in the Terminal Module (TM) has occurred.
Fault value (r0949, interpret decimal):
1: Background time slice is blocked.
2: Checksum over the code memory is not OK.

Remedy.RemedyText: - replace the Terminal Module (TM).
- if required, upgrade the firmware in the Terminal Module.
- contact Technical Support.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, CU_LINK, HLA, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM41, TM54F_MA, TM54F_SL, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: TM DRIVE-CLiQ (CU): Sign-of-life missing
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Internal (DRIVE-CLiQ) communication error

Cause.CauseText: A DRIVE-CLiQ communication error has occurred from the Terminal Module involved (TM) to the Control Unit.
The DRIVE-CLiQ component did not set the sign-of-life to the Control Unit.
Fault cause:
The sign-of-life bit in the receive telegram is not set.
Note regarding the message value:
The individual information is coded as follows in the message value (r0949/r2124):
0000yyxx hex: yy = component number, xx = error cause

Remedy.RemedyText: Upgrade the firmware of the component involved.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, CU_LINK, HLA, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM41, TM54F_MA, TM54F_SL, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: TM DRIVE-CLiQ (CU): Telegram error
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Internal (DRIVE-CLiQ) communication error

Cause.CauseText: A DRIVE-CLiQ communication error has occurred from the Terminal Module involved (TM) to the Control Unit.
Fault cause:
Checksum error (CRC error).
Telegram is shorter than specified in the length byte or in the receive list.
Telegram is longer than specified in the length byte or in the receive list.
The length of the receive telegram does not match the receive list.
The type of the receive telegram does not match the receive list.
The address of the power unit in the telegram and in the receive list do not match.
The DRIVE-CLiQ communication from the DRIVE-CLiQ component involved to the Control Unit signals that the supply voltage has failed.
The receive telegram is too early.
CRC error and the receive telegram is too early.
The telegram is shorter than that specified in the length byte or in the receive list and the receive telegram is too early.
The telegram is longer than that specified in the length byte or in the receive list and the receive telegram is too early.
The length of the receive telegram does not match the receive list and the receive telegram is too early.
The type of the receive telegram does not match the receive list and the receive telegram is too early.
The address of the power unit in the telegram and in the receive list does not match and the receive telegram is too early.
The error bit in the receive telegram is set and the receive telegram is too early.
Note regarding the message value:
The individual information is coded as follows in the message value (r0949/r2124):
0000yyxx hex: yy = component number, xx = error cause

Remedy.RemedyText: - carry out a POWER ON (switch-off/switch-on).
- check the electrical cabinet design and cable routing for EMC compliance
- check the DRIVE-CLiQ wiring (interrupted cable, contacts, ...).

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, CU_LINK, HLA, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM41, TM54F_MA, TM54F_SL, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: TM: power supply voltage failed
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Supply voltage fault (undervoltage)

Cause.CauseText: The DRIVE-CLiQ communication from the DRIVE-CLiQ component involved to the Control Unit signals that the supply voltage has failed.
Fault cause:
The power supply voltage for the components has failed.
Note regarding the message value:
The individual information is coded as follows in the message value (r0949/r2124):
0000yyxx hex: yy = component number, xx = error cause

Remedy.RemedyText: - carry out a POWER ON (switch-off/switch-on).
- check the power supply voltage wiring for the DRIVE-CLiQ component (interrupted cable, contacts, ...).
- check the dimensioning of the power supply for the DRIVE-CLiQ component.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, CU_LINK, HLA, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM41, TM54F_MA, TM54F_SL, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: TM DRIVE-CLiQ (CU): Cyclic data transfer error
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Internal (DRIVE-CLiQ) communication error

Cause.CauseText: A DRIVE-CLiQ communication error has occurred from the Terminal Module involved (TM) to the Control Unit.
The nodes do not send and receive in synchronism.
Fault cause:
Sign-of-life bit in the receive telegram not set and the receive telegram is too early.
The cyclic telegram has not been received.
Timeout in the telegram receive list.
Timeout in the telegram send list.
Error at the transition to cyclic operation.
Note regarding the message value:
The individual information is coded as follows in the message value (r0949/r2124):
0000yyxx hex: yy = component number, xx = error cause

Remedy.RemedyText: - check the power supply voltage of the component involved.
- carry out a POWER ON.
- replace the component involved.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, CU_LINK, HLA, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM41, TM54F_MA, TM54F_SL, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: TM DRIVE-CLiQ (CU): Error when sending DRIVE-CLiQ data
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Internal (DRIVE-CLiQ) communication error

Cause.CauseText: A DRIVE-CLiQ communication error has occurred from the Terminal Module involved (TM) to the Control Unit.
Data were not able to be sent.
Fault cause:
Telegram type does not match send list.
Note regarding the message value:
The individual information is coded as follows in the message value (r0949/r2124):
0000yyxx hex: yy = component number, xx = error cause

Remedy.RemedyText: Carry out a POWER ON.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, CU_LINK, HLA, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM41, TM54F_MA, TM54F_SL, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: TM DRIVE-CLiQ (CU): Component fault
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Internal (DRIVE-CLiQ) communication error

Cause.CauseText: Fault detected on the DRIVE-CLiQ component (Terminal Module) involved. Faulty hardware cannot be excluded.
Fault cause:
Error in the telegram header.
Receive error: The telegram buffer memory contains an error.
Send error: The telegram buffer memory contains an error.
Send error: The telegram buffer memory contains an error.
Response received too late during runtime measurement.
Time taken to exchange characteristic data too long.
Note regarding the message value:
The individual information is coded as follows in the message value (r0949/r2124):
0000yyxx hex: yy = component number, xx = error cause

Remedy.RemedyText: - check the DRIVE-CLiQ wiring (interrupted cable, contacts, ...).
- check the electrical cabinet design and cable routing for EMC compliance
- if required, use another DRIVE-CLiQ socket (p9904).
- replace the component involved.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, CU_LINK, HLA, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM41, TM54F_MA, TM54F_SL, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: TM DRIVE-CLiQ (CU): Alternating cyclic data transfer error
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Internal (DRIVE-CLiQ) communication error

Cause.CauseText: A DRIVE-CLiQ communication error has occurred from the Terminal Module involved (TM) to the Control Unit.
Fault cause:
Synchronization error during alternating cyclic data transfer.
Note regarding the message value:
The individual information is coded as follows in the message value (r0949/r2124):
0000yyxx hex: yy = component number, xx = error cause

Remedy.RemedyText: Carry out a POWER ON.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, CU_LINK, HLA, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM41, TM54F_MA, TM54F_SL, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: TM DRIVE-CLiQ (CU): Inconsistent component properties
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Internal (DRIVE-CLiQ) communication error

Cause.CauseText: The properties of the DRIVE-CLiQ component (Terminal Module), specified by the fault value, have changed in an incompatible fashion with respect to the properties when booted. One cause can be, e.g. that a DRIVE-CLiQ cable or DRIVE-CLiQ component has been replaced.
Fault value (r0949, interpret decimal):
Component number.

Remedy.RemedyText: - carry out a POWER ON.
- when a component is replaced, the same component type and if possible the same firmware version should be used.
- when a cable is replaced, only cables whose length is the same as or as close as possible to the length of the original cables should be used (ensure compliance with the maximum cable length).

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, HLA, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM41, TM54F_MA, TM54F_SL, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: TM: Unknown fault
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: General drive fault

Cause.CauseText: A fault has occurred on the Terminal Module that cannot be interpreted by the Control Unit firmware.
This can occur if the firmware on this component is more recent than the firmware on the Control Unit.
Fault value (r0949, interpret decimal):
Fault number.
Note:
If required, the significance of this new fault can be read about in a more recent description of the Control Unit.

Remedy.RemedyText: - replace the firmware on the Terminal Module by an older firmware version (r0158).
- upgrade the firmware on the Control Unit (r0018).

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, HLA, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: TM: I2C bus error occurred
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Hardware/software error

Cause.CauseText: An error has occurred while accessing the internal I2C bus of the Terminal Module.

Remedy.RemedyText: Replace the Terminal Module.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, HLA, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: TM: EEPROM
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Hardware/software error

Cause.CauseText: An error has occurred accessing the non-volatile memory on the Terminal Module.

Remedy.RemedyText: Replace the Terminal Module.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, HLA, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: TM: Parameter access
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Hardware/software error

Cause.CauseText: The Control Unit attempted to write an illegal parameter value to the Terminal Module.

Remedy.RemedyText: - check whether the firmware version of the Terminal Module (r0158) matches the firmware version of Control Unit (r0018).
- if required, replace the Terminal Module.
Note:
The firmware versions that match each other are in the readme.txt file on the memory card.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, HLA, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: TM: 24 V power supply missing
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Supply voltage fault (undervoltage)

Cause.CauseText: The 24 V power supply for the digital outputs is missing.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret hexadecimal):
01: TM17 24 V power supply for DI/DO 0 ... 7 missing.
02: TM17 24 V power supply for DI/DO 8 ... 15 missing.
04: TM15 24 V power supply for DI/DO 0 ... 7 (X520) missing.
08: TM15 24 V power supply for DI/DO 8 ... 15 (X521) missing.
10: TM15 24 V power supply for DI/DO 16 ... 23 (X522) missing.
20: TM41 24 V power supply for DI/DO 0 ... 3 missing.

Remedy.RemedyText: Check the terminals for the power supply voltage (L1+, L2+, L3+, M or +24 V_1 for TM41).

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, HLA, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: TM: Hardware initialization error
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Hardware/software error

Cause.CauseText: The Terminal Module was not successfully initialized.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret hexadecimal):
01: TM17 or TM41 - incorrect configuration request.
02: TM17 or TM41 - programming not successful.
04: TM17 or TM41 - invalid time stamp

Remedy.RemedyText: Carry out a POWER ON.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, HLA, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: TM: Module overtemperature
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Overtemperature of the electronic components

Cause.CauseText: The temperature in the module has exceeded the highest permissible limit.

Remedy.RemedyText: - reduce the ambient temperature.
- replace the Terminal Module.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, HLA, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: TM: Clock synchronous operation sign-of-life missing
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Communication error to the higher-level control system

Cause.CauseText: The maximum permissible number of errors in the master sign-of-life (clock synchronous operation) has been exceeded in cyclic operation.
When the alarm is output, the module outputs are reset up to the next synchronization.

Remedy.RemedyText: - check the physical bus configuration (terminating resistor, shielding, etc.).
- check the interconnection of the master sign-of-life (r4201 via p0915).
- check whether the master correctly sends the sign-of-life (e.g. set up a trace with r4201.12 ... r4201.15 and trigger signal r4301.9).
- check the bus and master for utilization level (e.g. bus cycle time Tdp was set too short).

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, HLA, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: TM: Error temperature sensor channel 0
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: External measured value / signal state outside the permissible range

Cause.CauseText: When evaluating the temperature sensor, an error occurred.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret decimal):
1: Wire breakage or sensor not connected.
2: Measured resistance too low.
PTC thermistor: R < 20 Ohm, KTY84: R < 50 Ohm (TM150: R < 180 Ohm), PT100: R < 60 Ohm, PT1000: R < 603 Ohm

Remedy.RemedyText: - make sure that the sensor is connected correctly.
- replace the sensor.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, HLA, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM120, TM150, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: TM: Error temperature sensor channel 1
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: External measured value / signal state outside the permissible range

Cause.CauseText: When evaluating the temperature sensor, an error occurred.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret decimal):
1: Wire breakage or sensor not connected.
2: Measured resistance too low.
PTC thermistor: R < 20 Ohm, KTY84: R < 50 Ohm (TM150: R < 180 Ohm), PT100: R < 60 Ohm, PT1000: R < 603 Ohm

Remedy.RemedyText: - make sure that the sensor is connected correctly.
- replace the sensor.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, HLA, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM120, TM150, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: TM: Error temperature sensor channel 2
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: External measured value / signal state outside the permissible range

Cause.CauseText: When evaluating the temperature sensor, an error occurred.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret decimal):
1: Wire breakage or sensor not connected.
2: Measured resistance too low.
PTC thermistor: R < 20 Ohm, KTY84: R < 50 Ohm (TM150: R < 180 Ohm), PT100: R < 60 Ohm, PT1000: R < 603 Ohm

Remedy.RemedyText: - make sure that the sensor is connected correctly.
- replace the sensor.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, HLA, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM120, TM150, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: TM: Error temperature sensor channel 3
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: External measured value / signal state outside the permissible range

Cause.CauseText: When evaluating the temperature sensor, an error occurred.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret decimal):
1: Wire breakage or sensor not connected.
2: Measured resistance too low.
PTC thermistor: R < 20 Ohm, KTY84: R < 50 Ohm (TM150: R < 180 Ohm), PT100: R < 60 Ohm, PT1000: R < 603 Ohm

Remedy.RemedyText: - make sure that the sensor is connected correctly.
- replace the sensor.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, HLA, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM41, TM54F_MA, TM54F_SL, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: TM: Internal software error
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Hardware/software error

Cause.CauseText: An internal software error has occurred.
Fault value (r0949, interpret decimal):
Information about the fault source.
Only for internal Siemens troubleshooting.

Remedy.RemedyText: - if necessary, upgrade the firmware in the Terminal Module to a later version.
- contact Technical Support.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, HLA, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM41, TM54F_MA, TM54F_SL, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: TM: Unknown alarm
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: General drive fault

Cause.CauseText: An alarm has occurred on the Terminal Module that cannot be interpreted by the Control Unit firmware.
This can occur if the firmware on this component is more recent than the firmware on the Control Unit.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret decimal):
Alarm number.
Note:
If required, the significance of this new alarm can be read about in a more recent description of the Control Unit.

Remedy.RemedyText: - replace the firmware on the Terminal Module by an older firmware version (r0158).
- upgrade the firmware on the Control Unit (r0018).

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, HLA, HUB, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Hub: Overtemperature component
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Overtemperature of the electronic components

Cause.CauseText: The temperature on the DRIVE-CLiQ Hub Module has exceeded the fault threshold.
Fault value (r0949, interpret decimal):
Actual temperature in 0.1 C resolution.

Remedy.RemedyText: - check ambient temperature at component installation location.
- replace the component involved.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, HLA, HUB, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Hub: Overtemperature alarm component
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Overtemperature of the electronic components

Cause.CauseText: The temperature on the DRIVE-CLiQ Hub Module has exceeded the alarm threshold.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret decimal):
Actual temperature in 0.1 C resolution.

Remedy.RemedyText: - check ambient temperature at component installation location.
- replace the component involved.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, HLA, HUB, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Hub: overvoltage fault 24 V supply
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Supply voltage fault (overvoltage)

Cause.CauseText: The 24 V power supply on the DRIVE-CLiQ Hub Module has exceeded the fault threshold.
Fault value (r0949, interpret decimal):
Actual operating voltage in 0.1 C resolution

Remedy.RemedyText: - check the supply voltage of the component involved.
- replace the component involved.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, HLA, HUB, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Hub: undervoltage fault 24 V supply
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Supply voltage fault (undervoltage)

Cause.CauseText: The 24 V power supply on the DRIVE-CLiQ Hub Module has undershot the fault threshold.
Fault value (r0949, interpret decimal):
Actual operating voltage in 0.1 C resolution

Remedy.RemedyText: - check the supply voltage of the component involved.
- replace the component involved.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, HLA, HUB, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC

SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Supply voltage fault (undervoltage)

Cause.CauseText: The 24 V power supply on the DRIVE-CLiQ Hub Module has undershot the alarm threshold.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret decimal):
Actual operating voltage in 0.1 C resolution

Remedy.RemedyText: - check the supply voltage of the component involved.
- replace the component involved.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, HLA, HUB, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Hub: Group signal
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: General drive fault

Cause.CauseText: The DRIVE-CLiQ Hub Module has detected at least one fault.

Remedy.RemedyText: Evaluates other actual messages.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, HLA, HUB, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Hub DRIVE-CLiQ: Sign-of-life missing
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Internal (DRIVE-CLiQ) communication error

Cause.CauseText: A DRIVE-CLiQ communications error has occurred from the Control Unit to the DRIVE-CLiQ Hub Module involved.
Fault cause:
The sign-of-life bit in the receive telegram is not set.
Note regarding the message value:
The individual information is coded as follows in the message value (r0949/r2124):
0000yyxx hex: yy = component number, xx = error cause

Remedy.RemedyText: - check the DRIVE-CLiQ connection.
- replace the component involved.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, HLA, HUB, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Hub: Time slice overflow
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Hardware/software error

Cause.CauseText: A time slice overflow has occurred on the DRIVE-CLiQ Hub Module.
Fault value (r0949, interpret decimal):
xx: Time slice number xx

Remedy.RemedyText: - reduce the current controller frequency.
- carry out a POWER ON (switch-off/switch-on) for all components.
- upgrade firmware to later version.
- contact Technical Support.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, HLA, HUB, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Hub: Checksum error
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Hardware/software error

Cause.CauseText: A checksum error has occurred when reading out the program memory on the DRIVE-CLiQ Hub Module.
Fault value (r0949, interpret hexadecimal):
Difference between the checksum at POWER ON and the actual checksum.

Remedy.RemedyText: - check whether the permissible ambient temperature for the component is maintained.
- replace the DRIVE-CLiQ Hub Module.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, HLA, HUB, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Hub: EEPROM checksum incorrect
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Hardware/software error

Cause.CauseText: The internal parameter data on the DRIVE-CLiQ Hub Module is incorrect.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret hexadecimal):
01: EEPROM access error.
02: Too many blocks in the EEPROM.

Remedy.RemedyText: - check whether the permissible ambient temperature for the component is maintained.
- replace the DRIVE-CLiQ Hub Module.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, HLA, HUB, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Hub DRIVE-CLiQ: Telegram error
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Internal (DRIVE-CLiQ) communication error

Cause.CauseText: A DRIVE-CLiQ communications error has occurred from the Control Unit to the DRIVE-CLiQ Hub Module involved.
Fault cause:
Checksum error (CRC error).
Telegram is shorter than specified in the length byte or in the receive list.
Telegram is longer than specified in the length byte or in the receive list.
The length of the receive telegram does not match the receive list.
The type of the receive telegram does not match the receive list.
The address of the component in the telegram and in the receive list do not match.
A SYNC telegram is expected - but the received telegram is not a SYNC telegram.
No SYNC telegram is expected - but the received telegram is one.
The error bit in the receive telegram is set.
The receive telegram is too early.
Note regarding the message value:
The individual information is coded as follows in the message value (r0949/r2124):
0000yyxx hex: yy = component number, xx = error cause

Remedy.RemedyText: - carry out a POWER ON (switch-off/switch-on).
- check the electrical cabinet design and cable routing for EMC compliance
- check the DRIVE-CLiQ wiring (interrupted cable, contacts, ...).

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, HLA, HUB, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Hub DRIVE-CLiQ: Cyclic data transfer error
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Internal (DRIVE-CLiQ) communication error

Cause.CauseText: A DRIVE-CLiQ communications error has occurred from the Control Unit to the DRIVE-CLiQ Hub Module involved. The nodes do not send and receive in synchronism.
Fault cause:
The cyclic telegram has not been received.
Timeout in the telegram receive list.
Timeout in the telegram send list.
Note regarding the message value:
The individual information is coded as follows in the message value (r0949/r2124):
0000yyxx hex: yy = component number, xx = error cause

Remedy.RemedyText: - carry out a POWER ON.
- replace the component involved.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, HLA, HUB, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Hub DRIVE-CLiQ: Send error for DRIVE-CLiQ data
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Internal (DRIVE-CLiQ) communication error

Cause.CauseText: A DRIVE-CLiQ communications error has occurred from the Control Unit to the DRIVE-CLiQ Hub Module involved. Data were not able to be sent.
Fault cause:
Telegram type does not match send list.
Note regarding the message value:
The individual information is coded as follows in the message value (r0949/r2124):
0000yyxx hex: yy = component number, xx = error cause

Remedy.RemedyText: Carry out a POWER ON.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, HLA, HUB, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Hub DRIVE-CLiQ: Component fault
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Internal (DRIVE-CLiQ) communication error

Cause.CauseText: Fault detected on the DRIVE-CLiQ component concerned. Faulty hardware cannot be excluded.
Fault cause:
Error in the telegram header.
Receive error: The telegram buffer memory contains an error.
Send error: The telegram buffer memory contains an error.
Send error: The telegram buffer memory contains an error.
Note regarding the message value:
The individual information is coded as follows in the message value (r0949/r2124):
0000yyxx hex: yy = component number, xx = error cause

Remedy.RemedyText: - check the DRIVE-CLiQ wiring (interrupted cable, contacts, ...).
- check the electrical cabinet design and cable routing for EMC compliance
- if required, use another DRIVE-CLiQ socket (p9904).
- replace the component involved.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, HLA, HUB, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Hub DRIVE-CLiQ: Cyclic data transfer error
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Internal (DRIVE-CLiQ) communication error

Cause.CauseText: A DRIVE-CLiQ communications error has occurred from the Control Unit to the DRIVE-CLiQ Hub Module involved.
Fault cause:
Synchronization error during alternating cyclic data transfer.
Note regarding the message value:
The individual information is coded as follows in the message value (r0949/r2124):
0000yyxx hex: yy = component number, xx = error cause

Remedy.RemedyText: Carry out a POWER ON.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, CU_LINK, HLA, HUB, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Hub DRIVE-CLiQ (CU): Sign-of-life missing
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Internal (DRIVE-CLiQ) communication error

Cause.CauseText: DRIVE-CLiQ communication error from DRIVE-CLiQ Hub Module in question to Control Unit.
The DRIVE-CLiQ component did not set the sign-of-life to the Control Unit.
Fault cause:
The sign-of-life bit in the receive telegram is not set.
Note regarding the message value:
The individual information is coded as follows in the message value (r0949/r2124):
0000yyxx hex: yy = component number, xx = error cause

Remedy.RemedyText: Upgrade the firmware of the component involved.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, CU_LINK, HLA, HUB, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Hub DRIVE-CLiQ (CU): Telegram error
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Internal (DRIVE-CLiQ) communication error

Cause.CauseText: DRIVE-CLiQ communication error from DRIVE-CLiQ Hub Module in question to Control Unit.
Fault cause:
Checksum error (CRC error).
Telegram is shorter than specified in the length byte or in the receive list.
Telegram is longer than specified in the length byte or in the receive list.
The length of the receive telegram does not match the receive list.
The type of the receive telegram does not match the receive list.
The address of the power unit in the telegram and in the receive list do not match.
The DRIVE-CLiQ communication from the DRIVE-CLiQ component involved to the Control Unit signals that the supply voltage has failed.
The receive telegram is too early.
CRC error and the receive telegram is too early.
The telegram is shorter than that specified in the length byte or in the receive list and the receive telegram is too early.
The telegram is longer than that specified in the length byte or in the receive list and the receive telegram is too early.
The length of the receive telegram does not match the receive list and the receive telegram is too early.
The type of the receive telegram does not match the receive list and the receive telegram is too early.
The address of the power unit in the telegram and in the receive list does not match and the receive telegram is too early.
The error bit in the receive telegram is set and the receive telegram is too early.
Note regarding the message value:
The individual information is coded as follows in the message value (r0949/r2124):
0000yyxx hex: yy = component number, xx = error cause

Remedy.RemedyText: - carry out a POWER ON (switch-off/switch-on).
- check the electrical cabinet design and cable routing for EMC compliance
- check the DRIVE-CLiQ wiring (interrupted cable, contacts, ...).

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, CU_LINK, HLA, HUB, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: HUB: power supply voltage failed
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Supply voltage fault (undervoltage)

Cause.CauseText: The DRIVE-CLiQ communication from the DRIVE-CLiQ component involved to the Control Unit signals that the supply voltage has failed.
Fault cause:
The power supply voltage for the components has failed.
Note regarding the message value:
The individual information is coded as follows in the message value (r0949/r2124):
0000yyxx hex: yy = component number, xx = error cause

Remedy.RemedyText: - carry out a POWER ON (switch-off/switch-on).
- check the power supply voltage wiring for the DRIVE-CLiQ component (interrupted cable, contacts, ...).
- check the dimensioning of the power supply for the DRIVE-CLiQ component.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, CU_LINK, HLA, HUB, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Hub DRIVE-CLiQ (CU): Cyclic data transfer error
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Internal (DRIVE-CLiQ) communication error

Cause.CauseText: DRIVE-CLiQ communication error from DRIVE-CLiQ Hub Module in question to the Control Unit.
The nodes do not send and receive in synchronism.
Fault cause:
Sign-of-life bit in the receive telegram not set and the receive telegram is too early.
The cyclic telegram has not been received.
Timeout in the telegram receive list.
Timeout in the telegram send list.
Error at the transition to cyclic operation.
Note regarding the message value:
The individual information is coded as follows in the message value (r0949/r2124):
0000yyxx hex: yy = component number, xx = error cause

Remedy.RemedyText: - check the supply voltage of the component involved.
- carry out a POWER ON.
- replace the component involved.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, CU_LINK, HLA, HUB, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Hub DRIVE-CLiQ (CU): Error when sending DRIVE-CLiQ data
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Internal (DRIVE-CLiQ) communication error

Cause.CauseText: DRIVE-CLiQ communication error from DRIVE-CLiQ Hub Module in question to Control Unit.
Data were not able to be sent.
Fault cause:
Telegram type does not match send list.
Note regarding the message value:
The individual information is coded as follows in the message value (r0949/r2124):
0000yyxx hex: yy = component number, xx = error cause

Remedy.RemedyText: Carry out a POWER ON.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, CU_LINK, HLA, HUB, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Hub DRIVE-CLiQ (CU): Component fault
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Internal (DRIVE-CLiQ) communication error

Cause.CauseText: Fault detected on the DRIVE-CLiQ component (DRIVE-CLiQ Hub Module) involved. Faulty hardware cannot be excluded.
Fault cause:
Error in the telegram header.
Receive error: The telegram buffer memory contains an error.
Send error: The telegram buffer memory contains an error.
Send error: The telegram buffer memory contains an error.
Response received too late during runtime measurement.
Time taken to exchange characteristic data too long.
Note regarding the message value:
The individual information is coded as follows in the message value (r0949/r2124):
0000yyxx hex: yy = component number, xx = error cause

Remedy.RemedyText: - check the DRIVE-CLiQ wiring (interrupted cable, contacts, ...).
- check the electrical cabinet design and cable routing for EMC compliance
- if required, use another DRIVE-CLiQ socket (p9904).
- replace the component involved.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, CU_LINK, HLA, HUB, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Hub DRIVE-CLiQ (CU): Alternating cyclic data transfer error
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Internal (DRIVE-CLiQ) communication error

Cause.CauseText: DRIVE-CLiQ communication error from DRIVE-CLiQ Hub Module in question to Control Unit.
Fault cause:
Synchronization error during alternating cyclic data transfer.
Note regarding the message value:
The individual information is coded as follows in the message value (r0949/r2124):
0000yyxx hex: yy = component number, xx = error cause

Remedy.RemedyText: Carry out a POWER ON.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, CU_LINK, HLA, HUB, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Hub DRIVE-CLiQ (CU): Inconsistent component properties
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Internal (DRIVE-CLiQ) communication error

Cause.CauseText: The properties of the DRIVE-CLiQ component (DRIVE-CLiQ Hub Module), specified by the fault value, have changed in an incompatible fashion with respect to the properties when booted. One cause can be, e.g. that a DRIVE-CLiQ cable or DRIVE-CLiQ component has been replaced.
Fault value (r0949, interpret decimal):
Component number.

Remedy.RemedyText: - carry out a POWER ON.
- when a component is replaced, the same component type and if possible the same firmware version should be used.
- when a cable is replaced, only cables whose length is the same as or as close as possible to the length of the original cables should be used (ensure compliance with the maximum cable length).

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, HLA, HUB, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Hub: Unknown fault
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: General drive fault

Cause.CauseText: A fault occurred on the DRIVE-CLiQ Hub Module that cannot be interpreted by the Control Unit firmware.
This can occur if the firmware on this component is more recent than the firmware on the Control Unit.
Fault value (r0949, interpret decimal):
Fault number.
Note:
If required, the significance of this new fault can be read about in a more recent description of the Control Unit.

Remedy.RemedyText: - replace the firmware on the DRIVE-CLiQ Hub Module with older firmware (r0158).
- upgrade the firmware on the Control Unit (r0018).

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Hub: Internal software error
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Hardware/software error

Cause.CauseText: An internal software error has occurred.
Fault value (r0949, interpret decimal):
Information about the fault source.
Only for internal Siemens troubleshooting.

Remedy.RemedyText: - if required, upgrade the firmware in the DRIVE-CLiQ Hub Module to a more recent version.
- contact Technical Support.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, HLA, HUB, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TM41, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Hub: Unknown alarm
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: General drive fault

Cause.CauseText: An alarm occurred on the DRIVE-CLiQ Hub Module that cannot be interpreted by the Control Unit firmware.
This can occur if the firmware on this component is more recent than the firmware on the Control Unit.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret decimal):
Alarm number.
Note:
If required, the significance of this new alarm can be read about in a more recent description of the Control Unit.

Remedy.RemedyText: - replace the firmware on the DRIVE-CLiQ Hub Module with older firmware (r0158).
- upgrade the firmware on the Control Unit (r0018).

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: HF Damping Module: overcurrent
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: General drive fault

Cause.CauseText: The power unit has detected an overcurrent condition.
- HF Choke Module or HF Damping Module defective.
- Resonance frequency of the output filter was excited.
Fault value (r0949, interpret bitwise binary):
Bit 0: Phase U.
Bit 1: Phase V.
Bit 2: Phase W.

Remedy.RemedyText: - check HF Choke Module and HF Damping Module and if required, replace.
- reduce the motor power in the proximity of the fault-generating frequency.
Note:
HF Choke Module (reactor module)
HF Damping Module

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: HF Damping Module: Damping voltage too high
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: General drive fault

Cause.CauseText: The damping voltage has reached an inadmissibly high value.
- a motor harmonic with a high amplitude has coincided with the resonance frequency of the output filter.
- the current controller excessively excites the resonance of the output filter.
Fault value (r0949, interpret decimal):
Damping voltage in the case of a fault [mV].

Remedy.RemedyText: - reduce the motor power in the proximity of the fault-generating frequency.
- check the current controller and if required, adapt.
- if required, use another motor.
Note:
HF Damping Module

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: HF Damping Module: Damping voltage not established
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: General drive fault

Cause.CauseText: A damping voltage was not able to be established.
Fault value (r0949, interpret decimal):
Damping voltage in the case of a fault [mV].

Remedy.RemedyText: Check the HF Damping Module wiring.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: HF Damping Module: Heat sink overtemperature
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Power electronics faulted

Cause.CauseText: The temperature of the heat sink in the HF Damping Module has exceeded the permissible limit value.
- insufficient cooling, fan failure.
- overload.
- ambient temperature too high.
Fault value (r0949, interpret decimal):
Temperature [0.01 C].

Remedy.RemedyText: - check whether the fan is running.
- check the fan elements.
- check whether the ambient temperature is in the permissible range.
Notice:
This fault can only be acknowledged after the alarm threshold for alarm A05000 has been undershot.
Note:
HF Damping Module

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: HF Damping Module: I2t overload
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Power electronics faulted

Cause.CauseText: The filter capacitor of the HF Damping Module was overloaded (r5173 = 100 %).
- the filter resonance frequency was excessively excited.
- the HF Choke Module is defective.
Fault value (r0949, interpret decimal):

Remedy.RemedyText: - reduce the motor power in the proximity of the fault-generating frequency.
- the system should not stay in a steady-state condition in the vicinity of the fault-generating frequency.
- check the HF Choke Module and if required replace.
Note:
HF Choke Module (reactor module)
HF Damping Module

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: HF Damping Module: Heat sink temperature sensor wire breakage
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: General drive fault

Cause.CauseText: The connection to one of the heat sink temperature sensors in the HF Damping Module is interrupted.
Fault value (r0949, interpret binary):
Bit 0: HF Damping Module
Bit 1: HF Choke Module

Remedy.RemedyText: Contact the manufacturer.
Note:
HF Choke Module (reactor module)
HF Damping Module

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: HF Damping Module: Heat sink temperature sensor short-circuit
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: General drive fault

Cause.CauseText: The heat sink temperature sensor in the HF Damping Module is short-circuited.
Fault value (r0949, interpret binary):
Bit 0: HF Damping Module
Bit 1: HF Choke Module

Remedy.RemedyText: Contact the manufacturer.
Note:
HF Choke Module (reactor module)
HF Damping Module

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: HF Damping Module: Overtemperature thermal model
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Power electronics faulted

Cause.CauseText: The temperature difference between the heat sink and chip has exceeded the permissible limit value.
- the permissible load duty cycle was not maintained.
- insufficient cooling, fan failure.
- overload.
- ambient temperature too high.
- pulse frequency too high.

Remedy.RemedyText: - adapt the load duty cycle.
- check whether the fan is running.
- check the fan elements.
- check whether the ambient temperature is in the permissible range.
- check the motor load.
- reduce the pulse frequency if this is higher than the rated pulse frequency.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: HF Damping Module: Chip overtemperature
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Power electronics faulted

Cause.CauseText: The chip temperature has exceeded the permissible limit value.
- the permissible load duty cycle was not maintained.
- insufficient cooling, fan failure.
- overload.
- ambient temperature too high.
- pulse frequency too high.
Fault value (r0949, interpret decimal):
Temperature difference between the heat sink and chip [0.01 C].

Remedy.RemedyText: - adapt the load duty cycle.
- check whether the fan is running.
- check the fan elements.
- check whether the ambient temperature is in the permissible range.
- check the motor load.
- reduce the pulse frequency if this is higher than the rated pulse frequency.
Note:
HF Damping Module

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: HF Damping Module: Internal overtemperature
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Power electronics faulted

Cause.CauseText: The alarm threshold for internal overtemperature has been reached.
If the temperature inside the unit continues to increase, fault F37036 may be triggered.
- ambient temperature might be too high.
- insufficient cooling, fan failure.
Fault value (r0949, interpret binary):
Bit 0 = 1: Control electronics range.
Bit 1 = 1: Power electronics range.

Remedy.RemedyText: - check the ambient temperature.
- check the fan for the inside of the unit.
Note:
HF Damping Module

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: HF Damping Module: Internal overtemperature
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Power electronics faulted

Cause.CauseText: The temperature inside the HF Damping Module has exceeded the permissible temperature limit.
- insufficient cooling, fan failure.
- overload.
- ambient temperature too high.
Fault value (r0949, interpret binary):
Bit 0 = 1: Control electronics range.
Bit 1 = 1: Power electronics range.

Remedy.RemedyText: - check whether the fan is running.
- check the fan elements.
- check whether the ambient temperature is in the permissible range.
Notice:
This fault can only be acknowledged once the permissible temperature limit minus 5 K has been undershot.
Note:
HF Damping Module

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: HF Damping Module: 24 V undervoltage
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Supply voltage fault (undervoltage)

Cause.CauseText: Failure of the 24 V power supply for the HF Damping Module.
- the undervoltage threshold was undershot for longer than 3 ms.
Fault value (r0949, interpret decimal):
24 V voltage [0.1 V].

Remedy.RemedyText: - check the 24 V DC voltage supply of the HF Damping Module.
- carry out a POWER ON (switch-off/switch-on) for the component.
Note:
HF Damping Module

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: HF Damping Module: 24 V undervoltage alarm
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Supply voltage fault (undervoltage)

Cause.CauseText: Fault in the 24 V power supply for the HF Damping Module.
- the 16 V threshold was undershot..
Alarm value (r2124, interpret decimal):
24 V voltage [0.1 V].

Remedy.RemedyText: - check the 24 V DC voltage supply of the HF Damping Module.
- carry out a POWER ON (switch-off/switch-on) for the component.
Note:
HF Damping Module

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: HF Damping Module: 24 V overvoltage
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Supply voltage fault (overvoltage)

Cause.CauseText: Overvoltage of the 24 V power supply for the HF Damping Module.
- the 31.5 V threshold was exceeded for more than 3 ms.

Remedy.RemedyText: Check the 24 V DC voltage supply of the HF Damping Module.
Note:
HF Damping Module

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: HF Damping Module: 24 V overvoltage alarm
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Supply voltage fault (overvoltage)

Cause.CauseText: Fault in the 24 V power supply for the HF Damping Module.
- the 32.0 V threshold was exceeded.

Remedy.RemedyText: Check the 24 V DC voltage supply of the HF Damping Module.
Note:
HF Damping Module

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: HF Damping Module: Supply undervoltage
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Supply voltage fault (undervoltage)

Cause.CauseText: Power supply fault in the HF Damping Module.
- the voltage monitor signals an undervoltage fault on the module.
Fault value (r0949, interpret decimal):
24 V voltage [0.1 V].

Remedy.RemedyText: - check the 24 V DC voltage supply of the HF Damping Module.
- carry out a POWER ON (switch-off/switch-on) for the component.
- replace the module if necessary.
Note:
HF Damping Module

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: HF Damping Module: Internal fan defective
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: General drive fault

Cause.CauseText: The internal fan of the HF Damping Module has failed.

Remedy.RemedyText: Check the internal fan of the HF Damping Module and replace if necessary.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: HF Damping Module: 24 V overvoltage fault
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Supply voltage fault (overvoltage)

Cause.CauseText: The voltage monitor signals an overvoltage fault on the module.

Remedy.RemedyText: - check the 24 V power supply.
- replace the module if necessary.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: HF Damping Module: EEPROM data error
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Hardware/software error

Cause.CauseText: EEPROM data error of the HF Damping Module.
Fault value (r0949, interpret hexadecimal):
0: The EEPROM data read in from the HF Damping Module is inconsistent.
1: EEPROM data is not compatible to the firmware of the HF Damping Module.
Additional values:
Only for internal Siemens troubleshooting.

Remedy.RemedyText: For fault value = 0:
Replace the HF Damping Module or update the EEPROM data.
For fault value = 1:
If necessary, upgrade the firmware to a later version.
Note:
HF Damping Module

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: HF Damping Module: Heat sink overtemperature
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Power electronics faulted

Cause.CauseText: The temperature of the HF Damping Module heat sink has exceeded the permissible limit value.
- insufficient cooling, fan failure.
- overload.
- ambient temperature too high.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret decimal):
Temperature [0.01 C].

Remedy.RemedyText: - check whether the fan is running.
- check the fan elements.
- check whether the ambient temperature is in the permissible range.
Notice:
This fault can only be acknowledged after the alarm threshold for alarm A05000 has been undershot.
Note:
HF Damping Module

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: HF Choke Module: Overtemperature
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Power electronics faulted

Cause.CauseText: The temperature of the HF Choke Module heat sink has exceeded the permissible limit value.
- insufficient cooling, fan failure.
- overload.
- ambient temperature too high.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret decimal):
Temperature [0.01 C].

Remedy.RemedyText: - check whether the fan is running.
- check the fan elements.
- check whether the ambient temperature is in the permissible range.
Notice:
This fault can only be acknowledged after the alarm threshold for alarm A05000 has been undershot.
Note:
HF Choke Module (reactor module)

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: HF Choke Module: Heat sink overtemperature
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Power electronics faulted

Cause.CauseText: The temperature of the HF Choke Module heat sink has exceeded the permissible limit value.
- insufficient cooling, fan failure.
- overload.
- ambient temperature too high.
Fault value (r0949, interpret decimal):
Temperature [0.01 C].

Remedy.RemedyText: - check whether the fan is running.
- check the fan elements.
- check whether the ambient temperature is in the permissible range.
- check the motor load.
Notice:
This fault can only be acknowledged after this alarm threshold for alarm A05000 has been undershot.
Note:
HF Choke Module (reactor module)

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: HF Choke Module: Overtemperature or fan failure
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Power electronics faulted

Cause.CauseText: The HF Choke Module signals an overtemperature or fan failure.
Fault F37313 is output if the alarm is present for longer than 30 s.

Remedy.RemedyText: - the cable between the HF Choke Module and the HF Damping Module has been withdrawn or is defective (X21).
- check the fan of the HF Choke Module and replace if necessary.
- check whether the ambient temperature is in the permissible range.
Note:
HF Choke Module (reactor module)
HF Damping Module

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: HF Choke Module: Overtemperature or fan failure
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Power electronics faulted

Cause.CauseText: Alarm A37312 to display overtemperature or fan failure in the HF Choke Module was signaled for longer than 30 s.

Remedy.RemedyText: - the cable between the HF Choke Module and the HF Damping Module has been withdrawn or is defective (X21).
- check the fan of the HF Choke Module and replace if necessary.
- check whether the ambient temperature is in the permissible range.
Note:
HF Choke Module (reactor module)
HF Damping Module

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: HF Damping Module: Damping voltage too high
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: General drive fault

Cause.CauseText: The damping voltage has exceeded the alarm threshold.
- a motor harmonic with a high amplitude has coincided with the resonance frequency of the output filter.
- the current controller excessively excites the resonance of the output filter.
If the damping voltage exceeds an inadmissibly high value, F37002 is output.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret decimal):
Damping voltage in the case of a fault [mV].

Remedy.RemedyText: - reduce the motor power in the proximity of the fault-generating frequency.
- check the current controller and if required, adapt.
- if required, use another motor.
Note:
HF Damping Module

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: HF Damping Module: Group signal
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: General drive fault

Cause.CauseText: The HF Damping Module has detected at least one fault.

Remedy.RemedyText: Evaluates other actual messages.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: HF Damping Module: Sign-of-life missing
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Internal (DRIVE-CLiQ) communication error

Cause.CauseText: There is a DRIVE-CLiQ communication error between the Control Unit and the HF Damping Module.
Fault cause:
The sign-of-life bit in the receive telegram is not set.
Note regarding the message value:
The individual information is coded as follows in the message value (r0949/r2124):
0000yyxx hex: yy = component number, xx = error cause

Remedy.RemedyText: - check the DRIVE-CLiQ connection.
- replace the component involved.
Note:
HF Damping Module

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: HF Damping Module: time slice overflow
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Hardware/software error

Cause.CauseText: A time slice overflow has occurred.

Remedy.RemedyText: - carry out a POWER ON (switch-off/switch-on) for all components.
- upgrade firmware to later version.
- contact Technical Support.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: HF Damping Module: CRC
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Hardware/software error

Cause.CauseText: A checksum error (CRC error) has occurred for the HF Damping Module.

Remedy.RemedyText: - carry out a POWER ON (switch-off/switch-on) for all components.
- upgrade firmware to later version.
- contact Technical Support.
Note:
HF Damping Module

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: HF Damping Module: EEPROM checksum incorrect
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Hardware/software error

Cause.CauseText: Internal parameter data is corrupted.
Fault value (r0949, interpret hexadecimal):
01: EEPROM access error.
02: Too many blocks in the EEPROM.

Remedy.RemedyText: Replace the module.
Note:
HF Damping Module

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: HF Damping Module: Telegram error
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Internal (DRIVE-CLiQ) communication error

Cause.CauseText: A DRIVE-CLiQ communication error has occurred from the Control Unit to the damping module.
Fault cause:
Checksum error (CRC error).
Telegram is shorter than specified in the length byte or in the receive list.
Telegram is longer than specified in the length byte or in the receive list.
The length of the receive telegram does not match the receive list.
The type of the receive telegram does not match the receive list.
The address of the component in the telegram and in the receive list do not match.
A SYNC telegram is expected - but the received telegram is not a SYNC telegram.
No SYNC telegram is expected - but the received telegram is one.
The error bit in the receive telegram is set.
The receive telegram is too early.
Note regarding the message value:
The individual information is coded as follows in the message value (r0949/r2124):
0000yyxx hex: yy = component number, xx = error cause

Remedy.RemedyText: - carry out a POWER ON (switch-off/switch-on).
- check the electrical cabinet design and cable routing for EMC compliance
- check the DRIVE-CLiQ wiring (interrupted cable, contacts, ...).
Note:
HF Damping Module

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: HF Damping Module: Cyclic data transmission error
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Internal (DRIVE-CLiQ) communication error

Cause.CauseText: There is a DRIVE-CLiQ communication error between the Control Unit and the HF Damping Module. The nodes do not send and receive in synchronism.
Fault cause:
The cyclic telegram has not been received.
Timeout in the telegram receive list.
Timeout in the telegram send list.
Note regarding the message value:
The individual information is coded as follows in the message value (r0949/r2124):
0000yyxx hex: yy = component number, xx = error cause

Remedy.RemedyText: - carry out a POWER ON.
- replace the component involved.
Note:
HF Damping Module

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: HF Damping Module: Send error for DRIVE-CLiQ data
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Internal (DRIVE-CLiQ) communication error

Cause.CauseText: There is a DRIVE-CLiQ communication error between the Control Unit and the HF Damping Module. Data were not able to be sent.
Fault cause:
Telegram type does not match send list.
Note regarding the message value:
The individual information is coded as follows in the message value (r0949/r2124):
0000yyxx hex: yy = component number, xx = error cause

Remedy.RemedyText: Carry out a POWER ON.
Note:
HF Damping Module

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: HF Damping Module: Component faulted
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Internal (DRIVE-CLiQ) communication error

Cause.CauseText: Fault detected on the DRIVE-CLiQ component concerned. Faulty hardware cannot be excluded.
Fault cause:
Error in the telegram header.
Receive error: The telegram buffer memory contains an error.
Send error: The telegram buffer memory contains an error.
Send error: The telegram buffer memory contains an error.
Note regarding the message value:
The individual information is coded as follows in the message value (r0949/r2124):
0000yyxx hex: yy = component number, xx = error cause

Remedy.RemedyText: - check the DRIVE-CLiQ wiring (interrupted cable, contacts, ...).
- check the electrical cabinet design and cable routing for EMC compliance
- if required, use another DRIVE-CLiQ socket (p9904).
- replace the component involved.
Note:
HF Damping Module

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: HF Damping Module: Cyclic data transmission error
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Internal (DRIVE-CLiQ) communication error

Cause.CauseText: There is a DRIVE-CLiQ communication error between the Control Unit and the HF Damping Module.
Fault cause:
Synchronization error during alternating cyclic data transfer.
Note regarding the message value:
The individual information is coded as follows in the message value (r0949/r2124):
0000yyxx hex: yy = component number, xx = error cause

Remedy.RemedyText: Carry out a POWER ON.
Note:
HF Damping Module

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: HF Damping Module: Internal software error
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Hardware/software error

Cause.CauseText: An internal software error in the HF Damping Module has occurred.
Fault value (r0949, interpret decimal):
Only for internal Siemens troubleshooting.

Remedy.RemedyText: - Replace the HF Damping Module
- if required, upgrade the firmware in the HF Damping Module.
- contact Technical Support.
Note:
HF Damping Module

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: HF Damping Module (CU): Sign-of-life missing
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Internal (DRIVE-CLiQ) communication error

Cause.CauseText: DRIVE-CLiQ communication error from the HF Damping Module to the Control Unit.
The DRIVE-CLiQ component did not set the sign-of-life to the Control Unit.
Fault cause:
The sign-of-life bit in the receive telegram is not set.
Note regarding the message value:
The individual information is coded as follows in the message value (r0949/r2124):
0000yyxx hex: yy = component number, xx = error cause

Remedy.RemedyText: Upgrade the firmware of the component involved.
Note:
HF Damping Module

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: HF Damping Module (CU): Telegram error
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Internal (DRIVE-CLiQ) communication error

Cause.CauseText: DRIVE-CLiQ communication error from the HF Damping Module to the Control Unit.
Fault cause:
Checksum error (CRC error).
Telegram is shorter than specified in the length byte or in the receive list.
Telegram is longer than specified in the length byte or in the receive list.
The length of the receive telegram does not match the receive list.
The type of the receive telegram does not match the receive list.
The address of the power unit in the telegram and in the receive list do not match.
The DRIVE-CLiQ communication from the DRIVE-CLiQ component involved to the Control Unit signals that the supply voltage has failed.
The receive telegram is too early.
CRC error and the receive telegram is too early.
The telegram is shorter than that specified in the length byte or in the receive list and the receive telegram is too early.
The telegram is longer than that specified in the length byte or in the receive list and the receive telegram is too early.
The length of the receive telegram does not match the receive list and the receive telegram is too early.
The type of the receive telegram does not match the receive list and the receive telegram is too early.
The address of the power unit in the telegram and in the receive list does not match and the receive telegram is too early.
The error bit in the receive telegram is set and the receive telegram is too early.
Note regarding the message value:
The individual information is coded as follows in the message value (r0949/r2124):
0000yyxx hex: yy = component number, xx = error cause

Remedy.RemedyText: - carry out a POWER ON (switch-off/switch-on).
- check the electrical cabinet design and cable routing for EMC compliance
- check the DRIVE-CLiQ wiring (interrupted cable, contacts, ...).
Note:
HF Damping Module

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: HF Damping Module: power supply voltage failed
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Supply voltage fault (undervoltage)

Cause.CauseText: The DRIVE-CLiQ communication from the DRIVE-CLiQ component involved to the Control Unit signals that the supply voltage has failed.
Fault cause:
The power supply voltage for the components has failed.
Note regarding the message value:
The individual information is coded as follows in the message value (r0949/r2124):
0000yyxx hex: yy = component number, xx = error cause

Remedy.RemedyText: - carry out a POWER ON (switch-off/switch-on).
- check the power supply voltage wiring for the DRIVE-CLiQ component (interrupted cable, contacts, ...).
- check the dimensioning of the power supply for the DRIVE-CLiQ component.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: HF Damping Module (CU): Cyclic data transmission error
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Internal (DRIVE-CLiQ) communication error

Cause.CauseText: DRIVE-CLiQ communication error from the damping module to the Control Unit.
The nodes do not send and receive in synchronism.
Fault cause:
Sign-of-life bit in the receive telegram not set and the receive telegram is too early.
The cyclic telegram has not been received.
Timeout in the telegram receive list.
Timeout in the telegram send list.
Error at the transition to cyclic operation.
Note regarding the message value:
The individual information is coded as follows in the message value (r0949/r2124):
0000yyxx hex: yy = component number, xx = error cause

Remedy.RemedyText: - check the supply voltage of the component involved.
- carry out a POWER ON.
- replace the component involved.
Note:
HF Damping Module

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: HF Damping Module (CU): Error when sending DRIVE-CLiQ data
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Internal (DRIVE-CLiQ) communication error

Cause.CauseText: DRIVE-CLiQ communication error from the HF Damping Module to the Control Unit.
Data were not able to be sent.
Fault cause:
Telegram type does not match send list.
Note regarding the message value:
The individual information is coded as follows in the message value (r0949/r2124):
0000yyxx hex: yy = component number, xx = error cause

Remedy.RemedyText: Carry out a POWER ON.
Note:
HF Damping Module

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: HF Damping Module (CU): Component faulted
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Internal (DRIVE-CLiQ) communication error

Cause.CauseText: Fault detected on the DRIVE-CLiQ component (HF Damping Module) involved. Faulty hardware cannot be excluded.
Fault cause:
Error in the telegram header.
Receive error: The telegram buffer memory contains an error.
Send error: The telegram buffer memory contains an error.
Send error: The telegram buffer memory contains an error.
Response received too late during runtime measurement.
Time taken to exchange characteristic data too long.
Note regarding the message value:
The individual information is coded as follows in the message value (r0949/r2124):
0000yyxx hex: yy = component number, xx = error cause

Remedy.RemedyText: - check the DRIVE-CLiQ wiring (interrupted cable, contacts, ...).
- check the electrical cabinet design and cable routing for EMC compliance
- if required, use another DRIVE-CLiQ socket (p9904).
- replace the component involved.
Note:
HF Damping Module

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: HF Damping Module (CU): Alternating cyclic data transmission error
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Internal (DRIVE-CLiQ) communication error

Cause.CauseText: DRIVE-CLiQ communication error from the HF Damping Module to the Control Unit.
Fault cause:
Synchronization error during alternating cyclic data transfer.
Note regarding the message value:
The individual information is coded as follows in the message value (r0949/r2124):
0000yyxx hex: yy = component number, xx = error cause

Remedy.RemedyText: Carry out a POWER ON.
Note:
HF Damping Module

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: HF Damping Module (CU): Component properties inconsistent
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Internal (DRIVE-CLiQ) communication error

Cause.CauseText: The properties of the DRIVE-CLiQ component (HF Damping Module), specified by the fault value, have changed in an incompatible fashion with respect to the properties when booted. One cause can be, e.g. that a DRIVE-CLiQ cable or DRIVE-CLiQ component has been replaced.
Fault value (r0949, interpret decimal):
Component number.

Remedy.RemedyText: - carry out a POWER ON.
- when a component is replaced, the same component type and if possible the same firmware version should be used.
- when a cable is replaced, only cables whose length is the same as or as close as possible to the length of the original cables should be used (ensure compliance with the maximum cable length).
Note:
HF Damping Module

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: HF Damping Module: Unknown fault
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: General drive fault

Cause.CauseText: A fault has occurred on the HF Damping Module that cannot be interpreted by the Control Unit firmware.
This can occur if the firmware on this component is more recent than the firmware on the Control Unit.
Fault value (r0949, interpret decimal):
Fault number.
Note:
If required, the significance of this new fault can be read about in a more recent description of the Control Unit.

Remedy.RemedyText: - replace the firmware on the HF Damping Module by an older firmware version (r0168).
- upgrade the firmware on the Control Unit (r0018).
Note:
HF Damping Module

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: HF Damping Module: I2C bus error occurred
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Hardware/software error

Cause.CauseText: Communications error with an EEPROM or an analog/digital converter.
Fault value (r0949, interpret hexadecimal):
- internal software error.
- module fault.

Remedy.RemedyText: For fault value = 80000000 hex:
- upgrade firmware to later version.
For fault value = 00000001 hex ... 0000FFFF hex:
- replace the module.
Note:
HF Damping Module

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: HF Damping Module: Internal software error
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Hardware/software error

Cause.CauseText: An internal software error has occurred.
Fault value (r0949, interpret decimal):
Information about the fault source.
Only for internal Siemens troubleshooting.

Remedy.RemedyText: - if necessary, upgrade the firmware in the HF Damping Module to a later version.
- contact Technical Support.
Note:
HF Damping Module

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: HF Damping Module: Unknown alarm
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: General drive fault

Cause.CauseText: An alarm has occurred on the HF Damping Module that cannot be interpreted by the Control Unit firmware.

Remedy.RemedyText: - replace the firmware on the HF Damping Module by an older firmware version (r0168).
- upgrade the firmware on the Control Unit (r0018).
Note:
HF Damping Module

SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Internal (DRIVE-CLiQ) communication error

Cause.CauseText: The configured transfer end time when transferring the cyclic actual values was exceeded.

Remedy.RemedyText: - carry out a POWER ON (switch-off/switch-on) for all components.
- contact Technical Support.
