SINAMICSAlarm.Type: All objects
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: CX32 DRIVE-CLiQ: Telegram error
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Internal (DRIVE-CLiQ) communication error

Cause.CauseText: A DRIVE-CLiQ communications error has occurred from the Control Unit to the controller extension involved.
Fault cause:
Checksum error (CRC error).
Telegram is shorter than specified in the length byte or in the receive list.
Telegram is longer than specified in the length byte or in the receive list.
The length of the receive telegram does not match the receive list.
The type of the receive telegram does not match the receive list.
The address of the component in the telegram and in the receive list do not match.
A SYNC telegram is expected - but the received telegram is not a SYNC telegram.
No SYNC telegram is expected - but the received telegram is one.
The error bit in the receive telegram is set.
The receive telegram is too early.
Note regarding the message value:
The individual information is coded as follows in the message value (r0949/r2124):
0000yyxx hex: yy = component number, xx = error cause

Remedy.RemedyText: - carry out a POWER ON (switch-off/switch-on).
- check the electrical cabinet design and cable routing for EMC compliance
- check the DRIVE-CLiQ wiring (interrupted cable, contacts, ...).

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Cooling unit: Fault occurred
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Auxiliary unit faulted

Cause.CauseText: The cooling unit signals a general fault.

Remedy.RemedyText: - check the wiring between the cooling unit and the input terminal (Terminal Module).
- check the external control device for the cooling unit.

RemedyParameterList.Text: p0266 (Cooling unit feedback signals signal source)

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Cooling unit: Conductivity has exceeded the fault threshold
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Auxiliary unit faulted

Cause.CauseText: The conductivity of the cooling liquid has exceeded the selected fault threshold (p0269[2]).

CauseParameterList.Text: p0261 (Cooling unit starting time 2), p0262 (Cooling unit fault conductivity delay time), p0266 (Cooling unit feedback signals signal source)

Remedy.RemedyText: Check the device to de-ionize the cooling liquid.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Cooling unit: ON command feedback signal missing
SINAMICSAlarm.ShortName: RKA: ON cmnd fdbk sig miss
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Auxiliary unit faulted

Cause.CauseText: The feedback signal of the ON command of the cooling unit is missing.
- after the ON command, the feedback signal has not been received within the selected starting time (p0260).
- the feedback signal has failed in operation.
- the cooling system was stopped by an external signal.

CauseParameterList.Text: p0260 (Cooling unit starting time 1), r0267 (Cooling unit status word)

Remedy.RemedyText: - check the wiring between the cooling unit and the input terminal (Terminal Module).
- check the wiring between the output terminal (Terminal Module) and the cooling system.
- check the external control device for the cooling unit.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Cooling unit: Liquid flow too low
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Auxiliary unit faulted

Cause.CauseText: The drive converter cooling unit signals that the cooling liquid flow is too low.
- after the ON command, the feedback signal has not been received within the selected starting time (p0260).
- in operation, the feedback signal has failed for longer than the permitted failure time (p0263).

CauseParameterList.Text: p0260 (Cooling unit starting time 1), p0263 (Cooling unit fault liquid flow delay time), r0267 (Cooling unit status word)

Remedy.RemedyText: - check the wiring between the cooling unit and the input terminal (Terminal Module).
- check the external control device for the cooling unit.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Cooling unit: Liquid leak is present
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Auxiliary unit faulted

Cause.CauseText: The liquid leakage monitoring function has responded.
Caution:
If this fault is reparameterized as an alarm, then using other monitoring functions it must be ensured that when cooling water is lost, the drive is switched off!

Remedy.RemedyText: - check the cooling system for leaks in the cooling circuit.
- check the wiring of the input terminal (Terminal Module) used to monitor leaking fluid.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Cooling unit: Power Stack Adapter, firmware version too old
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Auxiliary unit faulted

Cause.CauseText: The firmware version in the Power Stack Adapter (PSA) is too old and does not support the liquid cooling.

Remedy.RemedyText: Upgrade the firmware. Check EEPROM data.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Cooling unit: Cooling liquid temperature has exceeded the fault threshold
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Auxiliary unit faulted

Cause.CauseText: The cooling liquid intake temperature has exceeded the specified fault threshold.
Note:
The value for the fault threshold depends on the power unit (hardware description data, e.g. 52 ... 55 C).

Remedy.RemedyText: Check the cooling system and the ambient conditions.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Cooling unit: Alarm has occurred
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Auxiliary unit faulted

Cause.CauseText: The cooling unit signals a general alarm.

Remedy.RemedyText: - check the wiring between the cooling unit and the input terminal (Terminal Module).
- check the external control device for the cooling unit.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Cooling unit: Conductivity has exceeded the alarm threshold
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Auxiliary unit faulted

Cause.CauseText: The conductivity of the cooling liquid has exceeded the selected alarm threshold (p0269[1]).
Note:
The threshold cannot be set higher than the fault threshold specified in the equipment description.

Remedy.RemedyText: Check the device to de-ionize the cooling liquid.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Cooling unit: Conductivity has exceeded the alarm threshold
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Auxiliary unit faulted

Cause.CauseText: Conductivity monitoring is set for the cooling liquid (r0267.7, from p0266[7]).

CauseParameterList.Text: p0261 (Cooling unit starting time 2), p0262 (Cooling unit fault conductivity delay time), p0266 (Cooling unit feedback signals signal source), r0267 (Cooling unit status word)

Remedy.RemedyText: Check the device to de-ionize the cooling liquid.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Cooling unit: Conductivity actual value is not valid
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Auxiliary unit faulted

Cause.CauseText: When monitoring the conductivity of the cooling liquid, there is a fault in the wiring or in the sensor.

Remedy.RemedyText: - check the wiring between the cooling unit and the Power Stack Adapter (PSA).
- check the function of the sensor to measure the conductivity.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Cooling unit: Cooling liquid temperature has exceeded the alarm threshold
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Auxiliary unit faulted

Cause.CauseText: The cooling liquid intake temperature has exceeded the specified alarm threshold.
Note:
The value for the alarm threshold depends on the power unit (hardware description data, e.g. 42 ... 50 C).

Remedy.RemedyText: Check the cooling system and the ambient conditions.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Excitation group signal fault
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: General drive fault

Cause.CauseText: The excitation sequence control signals a fault.
Fault value (r0949, interpret binary):
Bit 0:
When switched off or when switching off the excitation, the signal "excitation ready feedback signal" was not received within the monitoring time.
Bit 1:
After an ON command, the signal "excitation ready feedback signal" was not received within the monitoring time.
Bit 2:
After the pulses were enabled, the signal "excitation operational feedback signal" was not received within the monitoring time.
Bit 3:
The "excitation group signal fault" signal is present.
Bit 4:
The switch-on command for the excitation was reset, although pulse enable (r0899.11) is still available, or the excitation current actual value has still not fallen below a minimum value.
Note:
This signal can be generated via p6500[59].

Remedy.RemedyText: - check the excitation.
- check commands, feedback signals and BICO interconnections.
- re bit 4: increase the switch-off delay time (p1647).

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Excitation group signal alarm
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: General drive fault

Cause.CauseText: The "excitation group signal alarm" signal is present.
Note:
This signal can be generated via p6500[58].

Remedy.RemedyText: Check the excitation equipment.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Excitation switch-off alarm
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Hardware/software error

Cause.CauseText: When switching off the excitation, after the delay time (p1647) has expired, the excitation current has still not decayed to zero.

Remedy.RemedyText: Extend the switch-off delay time in (p1647).
Note:
The alarm is automatically withdrawn after adapting p1647.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: Excitation: incorrect parameterization of the brushless exciter
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: General drive fault

Cause.CauseText: The brushless exciter has not been completely parameterized. The speed-dependent ratio cannot be calculated. As a consequence, it is assumed to be 1.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret decimal):
Parameter number that is assigned an illegal value.

Remedy.RemedyText: Set a value <> 0 for the parameter that is displayed.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, CU_LINK, CU_S120_DP, CU_S120_PN, CU_S150_DP, CU_S150_PN, ENC, HLA, HUB, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TB30, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM41, TM54F_MA, TM54F_SL, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: COMM BOARD: Alarm 2
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Communication error to the higher-level control system

Cause.CauseText: CBE20 SINAMICS Link:
A specific telegram word (send) is being used twice.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret decimal):
Telegram word used twice

Remedy.RemedyText: CBE20 SINAMICS Link:
Correct the parameter assignment.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, CU_LINK, CU_S120_DP, CU_S120_PN, CU_S150_DP, CU_S150_PN, ENC, HLA, HUB, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TB30, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM41, TM54F_MA, TM54F_SL, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: COMM BOARD: Alarm 3
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Communication error to the higher-level control system

Cause.CauseText: CBE20 SINAMICS Link:
A specific telegram word (receive) is being used twice.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret hexadecimal):
yyyyxxxx hex: yyyy = info. 1, xxxx = info. 2
Info. 1 (decimal) = Address of sender
Info. 2 (decimal) = Receive telegram word

CauseParameterList.Text: p8870 (SINAMICS Link PZD receive word), p8872 (SINAMICS Link PZD receive address)

Remedy.RemedyText: CBE20 SINAMICS Link:
Correct the parameter assignment.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, CU_LINK, CU_S120_DP, CU_S120_PN, CU_S150_DP, CU_S150_PN, ENC, HLA, HUB, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TB30, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM41, TM54F_MA, TM54F_SL, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: COMM BOARD: Alarm 4
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Communication error to the higher-level control system

Cause.CauseText: CBE20 SINAMICS Link:
- telegram word (receive) and address of sender inconsistent. Both values have to be either equal to zero or not equal to zero.
- address of the sender > maximum project address.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret hexadecimal):
yyyyxxxx hex: yyyy = info. 1, xxxx = info. 2
Info. 1 (decimal) = Drive object number from p8870, p8872
Info. 2 (decimal) = Index from p8870, p8872

Remedy.RemedyText: In the case of CBE20 SINAMICS Link:
Correct the parameter assignment.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, CU_LINK, CU_S120_DP, CU_S120_PN, CU_S150_DP, CU_S150_PN, ENC, HLA, HUB, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TB30, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM41, TM54F_MA, TM54F_SL, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: COMM BOARD: Alarm 5
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Communication error to the higher-level control system

Cause.CauseText: CBE20 SINAMICS Link:
Sender not found on SINAMICS Link.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret decimal):
0: synchronization to the bus clock cycle unsuccessful.
1 ... 64: address of the sender that was not found.

Remedy.RemedyText: CBE20 SINAMICS Link:
Check the connection to the sender.
Set parameters p8811, p8812[1] to identical values for all participants/nodes.
Check parameter p8836 for all participants.

RemedyParameterList.Text: p8811 (SINAMICS Link project selection), p8812 (SINAMICS Link clock cycle settings), p8836 (SINAMICS link node address)

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, CU_LINK, CU_S120_DP, CU_S120_PN, CU_S150_DP, CU_S150_PN, ENC, HLA, HUB, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TB30, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM41, TM54F_MA, TM54F_SL, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: COMM BOARD: Alarm 6
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Communication error to the higher-level control system

Cause.CauseText: CBE20 SINAMICS Link:
The parameter assignment indicates that the sender and the receiver are one and the same. This is not permitted.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret hexadecimal):
yyyyxxxx hex: yyyy = info. 1, xxxx = info. 2
Info. 1 (decimal) = Drive object number from p8872
Info. 2 (decimal) = Index from p8872

CauseParameterList.Text: p8836 (SINAMICS link node address), p8872 (SINAMICS Link PZD receive address)

Remedy.RemedyText: In the case of CBE20 SINAMICS Link:
Correct the parameter assignment. All p8872[index] must be set to a value not equal to p8836.

SINAMICSAlarm.Type: A_INF, B_INF, CU_LINK, CU_S120_DP, CU_S120_PN, CU_S150_DP, CU_S150_PN, ENC, HLA, HUB, R_INF, S_INF, SERVO, SERVO_AC, SERVO_I_AC, TB30, TM120, TM15, TM150, TM15DI_DO, TM17, TM31, TM41, TM54F_MA, TM54F_SL, VECTOR, VECTOR_AC, VECTOR_I_AC
SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: COMM BOARD: Alarm 7
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Communication error to the higher-level control system

Cause.CauseText: CBE20 SINAMICS Link:
A send telegram word is greater than possible in the project.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret hexadecimal):
yyyyxxxx hex: yyyy = info. 1, xxxx = info. 2
Info. 1 (decimal) = drive object number from p8871
Info. 2 (decimal) = index from p8871

CauseParameterList.Text: p8811 (SINAMICS Link project selection), p8871 (SINAMICS Link PZD send word)

Remedy.RemedyText: In the case of CBE20 SINAMICS Link:
Correct the parameter assignment.

Cause.CauseText: CBE20 SINAMICS Link:
A receive telegram word is greater than possible in the project.
Alarm value (r2124, interpret hexadecimal):
yyyyxxxx hex: yyyy = info. 1, xxxx = info. 2
Info. 1 (decimal) = drive object number from p8870
Info. 2 (decimal) = index from p8870

Remedy.RemedyText: In the case of CBE20 SINAMICS Link:

SINAMICSAlarm.LongName: EtherNetIP/COMM BOARD: configuration error
SINAMICSAlarm.MsgClass: Communication error to the higher-level control system

Cause.CauseText: CBE20 EtherNet/IP:
An EtherNet/IP controller attempts to establish a connection using an incorrect configuring telegram.
The telegram length set in the controller does not match the parameterization in the drive device.

Remedy.RemedyText: Check the set telegram length.
Note:
PZD interface 1:
For p0922 not equal to 999, then the length of the selected telegram applies.
For p0922 = 999, the maximum interconnected PZD (r2067) applies.
PZD interface 2:
The maximum interconnected PZD (r8867) applies.
